loans.name: Isroil

texts.en: Isroil began a livestock business 20 years ago. He cares for his livestock very well, and in this way, Isroil develops his business year by year. He sells meat and milk to the local people. Isroil’s products ensure meals for his fellow citizens. He has a wife and two children. His income doesn’t fully cover his modern life. That’s why he also works as a driver. Isroil tries to do the best for his family’s comfort. His aim is to buy corrugated asbestos boards for repairing his house.

loans.use: To buy corrugated asbestos boards

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Emprendedores del Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la ganadería, desde hace 7 años, comenta que trabaja sola en su casa todos los días, además vende productos de maquillaje por catálogos. Ella ofrece sus productos y sus clientes llegan a su domicilio comprar.
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en las ferias de la ciudad de San Fernando, ya que le venden a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará terneros, pollos, conejos, patos gallinas para abastecer su ganadería.
Una de las metas de Sonia son comprar un vehículo, específicamente una camioneta para transportar su mercadería y comprar con más facilidad sus animales, ya que ella misma los llevaría.
Sonia vive junto a su marido. Sus sueños son seguir creciendo con su ganadería y a la vez adquirir más animales, así con optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Sonia is part of the communal bank “Emprendedores del Futuro” in the city of San Fernando.  For seven years she has been in the business of raising livestock.  She reports that she works on her own at home every day, and she also sells cosmetic products from catalogues.  Her clients come to her home to buy these products.  She buys these items in the markets of her city, since they are sold there at low cost.

With the loan funds she will buy turtles, chickens, rabbits, ducks and hens to add to her livestock.  One of her goals is to buy a vehicle, specifically a pickup truck to transport her merchandise and animals more easily, since she has to transport them herself.  

She lives with her husband.  Her dream is to keep growing her livestock business and acquire more animals, with the aim of having a better quality of life. She is very happy and grateful for this opportunity brought to her by Fondo Esperanza, since this has permitted her to invest in her business.  Further, she is very comfortable being in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank.  They all have different business activities and interests, and this makes things more interesting.  Thanks to the training sessions that have taken place at the meetings, she has learned how to run her business more effectively.

San Fernando is a city located in the region Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgin in the central area of Chile.  The economic activity of the city is based primarily on agriculture (vineyards, fruit trees, beets, wheat, tobacco and traditional crops), agroindustry (export of fruits, preserved goods, dairy products, etc.), and other commerce.

loans.use: to buy turtles, chickens, rabbits, ducks and hens to add to her livestock.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la venta y reparación de bicicletas, pues quiere comprarse repuestos no hemos para poder tener a disponibilidad del cliente su inversión será en pedales, Catarina, maniubros, frenos, cadenas, ya que esto le permitirá atender siempre bien a su clientela.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con un préstamo anterior ya que le permitió realizar una buena inversión y poder tener mejores ventas, este crédito le mejoró también su estabilidad económica familiar.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan for repairing and selling bicycles, because she wants to purchase spare parts in order to have them available to her customers. She will invest in pedals, sprocket wheels, handlebars, brakes and seats, and this will allow her to always serve her customers well.
She got a positive result from her previous loan, since she was able to put it to good use and make better sales. The loan also improved her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase pedals, sprocket wheels, handlebars, brakes and seats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide.

loans.name: Milagro Isabel

texts.es:
Milagro, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el cultivo de pipián y maíz, pues para esto deberá comprarse los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, y foliares, que son los que le ayuda a prevenir las plagas durante el desarrollo del cultivo.
Ella Se decidió por este préstamo debido al efecto que tuvo con el anterior, pues le ayudó a mejorar la cosecha y a obtener una buena producción, su condición una familia ha mejorado ya que dependen de la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Milagro is requesting a new loan to invest in the cultivation of squash and corn. She needs to purchase the necessary supplies such as compost, herbicides and foliar fertilizers, which help her prevent pest infestations during crop development. 

She decided on this loan because of the result she had with the previous one, which helped her to improve her harvest and obtain a good yield. The conditions of her family have improved, since they depend on agricultural production.

loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicides and foliar fertilizers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and married with two children. Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marites has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s sanitary supply business.

With the loan investment, he will buy sanitary supplies such as pipes, taps, etc. in larger quantities. This will allow him to fulfill larger orders on time and increase his profits.

He has been operating his business for many years and is a very experienced person now. Allah Rakhi is hopeful that he will get further established in his business by using this loan.

Allah Rakhi is a housewife. She remains at home and does her household responsibilities.

She has given birth to six children and takes care of them very well. Her two elder sons work and contribute to the family financially.

She is very positive in her thinking and hopeful about her family’s future.

loans.use: To buy taps and pipes for her husband's sanitary supply business

loans.name: Jordan David

texts.es:
Jordan es un joven de 21 años de edad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que tiene un clima muy cálido y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, pallares, paprika, entre otros, se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, la cual es  muy visitada en todo el año por infinidad de turistas. Cuando Jordan tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio, ya que se distrae mucho y sobre todo pasa un momento divertido y agradable, en ocasiones también le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Sus padres afortunadamente pudieron brindarle una buena educación y por ello el logro estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica.

Con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo Jordan trabaja como mecánico de conversión de vehículos de gasolineros a gas, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias, en un trabajo un poco tedioso sobre todo porque tiene que tener mucho cuidado en la instalación; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque lo hace con mucha responsabilidad.

Jordan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas como destornilladores, gata, alicates, así como equipos para la instalación de los tanques de gas en los vehículos, así el podrá realizar mejor sus labores y poder realizar un mejor trabajo, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un auto”.
texts.en:
Jordan, 21, lives in Ica, a city that has a warm climate and many agricultural products such as grapes, asparagus, butter beans, peppers, etc.  These are found in the Huacachina lagoon which is visited by many tourists all year long.  When Jordan has some free time, he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends from his neighborhood.  That is a good distraction and he spends a fun and agreeable time.  He also likes to eat one of this favorite dishes, the delicious “Aji de Gallina” (traditional chicken stew).  Luckily for him his parents could give him a good education and so he was able to study mechanical engineering.

Jordan works with a lot of enthusiasm and effort as a mechanic who converts gas-powered vehicles to those using natural gas.  He works about 9 hours a day.  It’s a little tedious, especially because he has to be very careful with the installation.  He believes that he’s doing well in his work because he is very responsible.

Jordan is very grateful for the Kiva loans since thanks to them he could buy tools such as screwdrivers, wrenches, pliers, as well as equipment to install gas tanks in vehicles.  In this way he can improve his work and do a better job and it allows him to keep trying every day to succeed with his big dream, “to have his own house and a car”.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz en semilla para sembrar abonos, herbicida, rastreo de la tierra, todo esto le permite iniciar su trabajo de una mejor manera, con la esperanza de que su producción sea abundante y sana.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le mejoró la productividad ya que obtuvo una buena cosecha dándole una mayor posibilidad para vender y de esta manera también tener ingresos a su familia
texts.en:
Elsa is requesting a new loan in order to buy corn seeds for planting, compost, and herbicides. She will also pay to have the land plowed. All of these expenses will enable her to start working with better conditions in hopes of having an abundant and fruitful harvest.

Elsa believes her previous loan improved her productivity since she was able to obtain a good harvest. This has given her a greater opportunity to sell so that she can generate income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and herbicides and to pay to have her land plowed.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, 67 years old, is a widow with 8 children. Norma works very hard to provide for them. She has operated a general store in the Philippines for 10 years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. Norma has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Banco Comunal La Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal La Esperanza está conformado por 12 integrantes todas con diferentes actividades económica las cuales se apoyan mutuamente anteriormente  han tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000 y han demostrado que son trabajadoras, responsable, trabajadoras presidenta de este grupo los motiva para que sigan adelante con sus negocios y generar ingresos a la familia. Reyna del Socorro es parte del grupo en el cual su actividad económica es la venta de hornados ( que significa plátanos entero con cuajadas), esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en la localidad donde ella habita. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar materia prima y poder incrementar el negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "La Esperanza" (The Hope) consists of 12 members, all of whom engage in different business activities that enable them to support one another. They previously took out a loan with Fundación León 2000 and have demonstrated that they are hardworking and responsible. The president of this group motivates her members to continue forward with their businesses so that they can generate income for their families.

Reyna del Socorro is a member of this group. She sells "hornados" (whole plantains served with curds). Reyna conducts her business as a street vendor in the town where she lives. She is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ermelita

texts.en: Ermelita, 50 years old, is married and has 5 children, two of them in school. Ermelita works very hard to provide for her children. For the past 6 years, Ermelita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as detergent, soap, snack foods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store. In the future, Ermelita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas, 62 years old, is married and has 6 children, one of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felicitas has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines for 10 years. The fiber from the abaca palm leaf is used for handicraft production. Felicitas has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. In the future, Felicitas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca business.

loans.name: Pc 2 Santhie 1 Joal Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc villageois a été crée il y a trois ans .

Il est composé de femmes d'un même quartier et de quartier et se partagent de bonnes relations sociales.

Elles s'activent dans leur majorité dans le petit commerce de détails.

Madame Bineta  est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 filles et 2 garçons .

Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes et fruits depuis longtemps . Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce 

domaine .

Son nouveau crédit de 70000 lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises Pour renforcer son activité.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent d'assurer la dépense quotidienne au niveau de sa famille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois has been created three years ago. It is composed of women living in the same neighborhood and maintaining good social ties. Most of them work as vendors.

Mrs. Bineta is a 48-year old married woman and the mother of five: three daughters and two sons. She has been selling vegetables and fruits for a long time. She has a good experience in this area.
Her new loan of 70,000 West African francs will allow her to replenish her stock in order to bolster her business. The income generated by her business will allow her to provide for everyday family needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables [for resale].

loans.name: Pc1 Santhie 1 Joal Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été fondé il y a un an .Il regroupe des femmes issus du même quartier et s'activant  

toutes dans le petit commerce de détails.Ses membres sont unis par de bonne relations sociales communes.

Madame Fatou est une femme mariée âgée de 55 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 garçons et 3 filles .

Elle fait du commerce de céréales depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience.

Son nouveau crédit de 125000 francs lui permettra de se payer du mil et du mais qu'elle va faire de la farine 

pour le revendre au détail.

Les bénéfices de son activité  lui permettent  de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et de participer 

aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was founded last year. It brings together women from the same neighborhood who all are active in small retail businesses. The members are united by good common social relations. 

Madame Fatou is a married women who is 55 years old. She is the mother of 6 children - 3 boys and 3 girls.

She has been selling grains for a long time and has good experience.

Her new loan for 125,000 francs will allow her to buy millet and corn, which she'll use to make flour. She'll sell this flour at retail. 

The income from her business allows her to pay for her children's school fees and to share in the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Patricia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Patricia  habitante del municipio de Nindiri, labora para una  empresa privada y su esposa  la apoya con los gastos del hogar, tienen dos hijos  que estudian, y su mayor sueño es  mejorar de vida,  en estos momentos Patricia quiere establecer una manzana de yuca para obtener nuevos  ingrsos en su familia. Gracias a Afodenic quien con fondos de Kiva ayudan las familias de escasos recursos.
Con este Financiamiento obtenido comprara: Fertilizante, Madera de Yuca, pagara el Arado de la Tierra. contenta Patricia dice que Dios Bendiga a Cada uno de los que la apoyan y agradece por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in the town of Nindiri.  She works for a private company, and her husband helps her with the household expenses.  They have two children who are in school.  Patricia’s biggest wish is to improve her life.  At this time Patricia wants to plant a manzana (about 1.7 acres) of cassava so she can bring in new income for her family.  She is grateful to AFODENIC, which has provided funding from Kiva to help low-income families.

Patricia will use this loan to purchase fertilizer and cassava plants, and to pay for her land to be plowed.  Patricia is happy to receive this loan, and says “God bless everyone who supports her”, and that she is grateful to them for trusting her.

loans.use: to plant cassava.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines for 3 years. Emily has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more canned goods, snack foods and other groceries to sell. In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Josefe

texts.en:
Josefe works hard to support her family. Josefe is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josefe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

Josefe has been in this business for five years now, and she also earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

In the future, Josefe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Truc

texts.en: Truc is requesting a new loan to buy food to sell. Truc's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and foods to sell from her stall

loans.name: Maria Colomba

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para su negocio en la venta de tortillas, pues quiere comprarse por cantidad mayor  los materiales como lo son el maíz, la leña, algunos plásticos que le permite empacar las tortillas, su objetivo con este préstamo en mantener el negocio estable ya que depende económicamente de él.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido una inversión muy importante con crédito anterior la cual le permitió tener los materiales por todo este tiempo y ha mantenido sus ventas a los clientes.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan for her business of selling tortillas. She wants to buy a large quantity of supplies such as corn, firewood, and plastic for packing the tortillas. Her goal for this loan is to keep her business stable since she is financially dependent on it.

María says she made an important investment with her previous loan. This enabled her to have supplies available all the time, which helped to maintain her sales to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and plastic.

loans.name: Srey Huoch

texts.en:
Srey Huoch (in the photo), age 22, is a garment worker. Her husband, Vanntha, age 29, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2010 and have a three-month-old daughter. 
 
Srey Huoch lives with her parents in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She wants to live in her own house, so she has decided to apply for her first Kiva loan in order to build her own home.

loans.use: To build her own house

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 31 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Rodelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rodelyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rodelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, cooking oil, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Rodelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es:
Patricia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos lácteos como el queso, crema, cuajada, requesón, que son productos que tienen demanda en el negocio, considera que estos préstamos le han dado una mayor fortaleza para mantenerse en sus ventas.
Con el préstamo anterior logró realizar una buena inversión, la cual le permitió tener siempre a la mano los productos lácteos, dándole más oportunidad para las ventas y para ganar clientela.
texts.en:
Patricia is requesting a new loan to buy dairy products such as cheese, cream, curd, and cottage cheese, which are all in demand at her business. She believes these loans have given her more strength to maintain her sales.

With the previous loan, she was able to make a good investment, which allowed her to continuously have dairy products available. This gives her more sales opportunities and the ability to gain customers.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, curd, and cottage cheese

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell-crafting business in the Philippines.

Chona has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her shell-crafting business.

She has been in this business for 12 years now, and she also earns additional income from her general store.

In the future, Chona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shell-crafting business

loans.name: Tomasa  Mauricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA RETAMA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa Mauricia; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de refrigerios y comidas, ella prepara sandwichs, empanadas, bocaditos, cafes, mates y lo ofrece a diferentes eventos que realiza como ceremonias y congresos, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar su negocio de venta de refrigerios y venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como verduras, panes, pollo y carne.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Tomasa Mauricia is a member of the Communal Bank "La Retama", which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, single, and has two children. Tomasa divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling refreshments and food. She prepares sandwiches, empanadas, hors d'oeuvres, coffee, and "mate" (a hot herbal beverage). Tomasa offers her food at different events, such as ceremonies and conferences. Through this business, she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her business of selling refreshments and food. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for cooking such as vegetables, bread, chicken, and meat.

Tomasa is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, bread, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de iniciar una nueva siembra de maíz y maicillo, pues están en la temporada agrícola donde todos los trabajadores de la tierra inicia esta labor, el se comprará abono, herbicidas, y para la preparación del terreno, con esto espera poder tener un buen inicio y al final recibir una buena producción.
El efecto con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que realizó una buena inversión en los cultivos de la cual recibió una calidad de cosecha abundante y sana, hasta el momento con esto ha logrado mantener a su familia en la alimentación,y tambien generando ganancias por la venta de la cosecha.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan due to the need to plant corn and sorghum again. It is currently the agricultural season, when all the farmers begin their work in the fields. José will buy fertilizer and herbicides, and he will also prepare his land. By doing this, he hopes to have a good start and to have good production at the end of the season.

His last loan had a positive effect, since he made a good investment in crops that had an abundant and healthy harvest. Until now, this has enabled José to maintain sufficient food for his family, and it has also generated income from selling the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides, and to prepare his land

loans.name: Walter Hugo

texts.es:
Walter es un joven de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad en la que se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial cultivos de algodón, vid, frutales, maíz entre otros, también tiene como una de sus actividades principales la pesca, con la cual muchos pobladores llevan el sustento para sus familias. Cuando Walter tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte en especial jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Debido a que sus padres eran muy humildes y tenían pocos recursos económicos el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración de Empresas.

Con mucho entusiasmo Walter trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, venta de ropa y verduras  en su pequeña bodega que tiene en su vivienda, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 35 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de buena calidad a un bajo precio.

Walter está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mostradores, vitrinas, ropa y también abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, conservas, golosinas, entre otros, así de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder  tener un mejor orden y limpieza en su negocio, lo que permitirá que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos y tengan más confianza de comprar sus productos, para asi poder seguir luchando cada día para poder conseguir cumplir su más grande sueño:”  Tener su casa propia y estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas”.
texts.en:
Walter is a young man of 26. He lives in the city of Pisco, which has an active agricultural sector, especially cotton, vine crops, fruit trees and corn, among others. Another leading activity is fishing, through which many villagers earn a living for their families. When Walter has free time, he really likes to play sports, especially soccer with his friends and neighbors in his area. He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "Arroz con Pato” [duck with rice]. Since his parents were of very humble origins and had few economic resources, he only went to secondary school, but he would have liked to study Business Administration. 

With great enthusiasm, Walter works in his business selling groceries, clothing and vegetables in a small store he operates in his home. He works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 35 customers in a day. He believes that his business is going well for him because he is very friendly with the customers, and above all, he offers good-quality products at a low price. 

Walter is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to him, he will be able to buy display cases, shelves, clothing and also groceries such as rice, sugar, canned goods, and candies, among other items. In this way, he will be able to improve his income and have greater order and cleanliness in his store, permitting his customers to feel more comfortable and have more confidence in buying his products. Thus he will be able to keep working hard every day so that he can achieve his greatest dream: "having his own house and studying for a degree in business administration."

loans.use: to buy display cases, shelves, clothing, groceries and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is married with three children: two daughters and one son. Her son works while her daughters are getting an education.
 
Rukhsana operates a canteen business in a school where she serves children different edible items like chips, biscuits and  home-cooked dishes like kebabs and chanay, which she sells with bread. She makes good sales every day. Children are very fond of her dishes and they love to buy from her. 

For the further improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah, which she will use to purchase edible items like potatoes, cooking oil, biscuits, juices and cold drinks because demands for them increases, especially in the summer season.  

She is hopeful that the addition of items in her canteen will take her business to a more profitable position.

loans.use: To buy edible items, cold drinks and juices for her canteen business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with five children who all attend school. She lives in her own home. She has been working as shopkeeper for a long time. She has a well-stocked grocery store in her home where she sells cashew nuts. 

Fatuma tells us that her business is doing very well because she has good customers and is well known in her area for her good customer service and the good prices she offers. Thanks to her work, she is able to maintain her household and cover any out-of-pocket expenses.

Fatuma is requesting this loan to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for her business. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving as it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna works hard to support her family. Digna is married and has a balut vending business in the Philippines.

Digna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more balut to sell to customers.

Digna has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Digna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more balut to sell to customers.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of coffees and beverages to restock her coffee shop. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her shop, increasing sales and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more coffee and beverages to sell

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fedila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rope-making business in the Philippines.

Fedila requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

She has been in this business for eight years now and earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Fedila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Yancy Magali

texts.es:
Yanci, está solicitando un préstamo para poder incrementar el negocio, dándole continuidad a la primera inversión, se comprará productos con nuevos estilos como blusas, falsas, ropa interior, camisas para caballero, todo esto nuevo, con la intención de mejorar el servicio a los clientes manteniendo prendas de vestir con estilos diferentes.
El préstamo anterior le permitió crecer, tener nuevos productos, aumentar su clientela y al mismo tiempo ha mejorado sus ingresos económicos a su familia, él manifiesta que estos préstamos son una herramienta para crecer y desarrollarse en el comercio.
texts.en:
Yanci is requesting a loan to increase her business, which will allow her to continue from her first investment. She will buy products in new styles such as blouses, skirts, undergarments, and men's shirts. Once again, she intends to improve the service to her customers by maintaining an inventory of clothes in different styles.

Her previous loan enabled her to grow, acquire new products, and increase her clientele. At the same time, she improved her family's income. Yanci says that the loans are the tools that help her to grow and develop in her trade.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, undergarments, and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Imma Concepcion

texts.en:
Imma Concepcion is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imma Concepcion is 45 years old. 

Imma Concepcion has been selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Imma Concepcion requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more blouses, pants, shoes and other clothing.

Imma Concepcion has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Imma Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, pants, shoes and other clothing to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married with three children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucy is 36 years old.  She has a shell craft business in the Philippines. Lucy requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy materials for her shell craft business.

Lucy has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell craft business.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, pues quiera repararse un freezer que es utilizado actualmente donde almacena las carnes, en ocasiones también de alimentos y vegetales como tomates, cebollas, este préstamo le servirá para pagar la mano de obra por el mantenimiento y comprarse cualquier repuesto de ser necesario.
Ella manifiesta que el credito anterior le ayudó para aumentar sus ganancias, ya que mantuvo una condición más estable en el negocio de la cual hasta el momento ha logrado mantenerse y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Sandra is requesting a new loan to keep investing in her business, since she would like to repair a freezer that she uses to store meats, and at times other foods and vegetables like tomatoes and onions. She plans to use this loan to pay for labor and maintenance and to buy whatever parts she needs. She says the previous loan helped her increase her profits to make the business more stable, and she has been able to keep it that way and help her family.

loans.use: to repair a freezer and to purchase vegetables like tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Orlando Felipe

texts.es:
Orlando continua con sus ventas,en su casa de habitacion, despachando en su pulperia, y que junto a su esposa se esfuerzan para seguir adelante, hoy en dia ella, labora como conserje de medio tiempo, teniendo estos ingresos para apoyar  a sus hijos. De cuatro solo tres estan casa, el otro esta en el pais de Costa Rica.
El negocio ha venido creciendo al introducir mas granos basicos, golosinas, siendo posible con mas capital, adquiriendo financiamiento. Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: quitales de frijoles, arroz, azucar, maiz, golosinas, gaseosas, producto de higiene personal y una vitrina para acomodar mas productos, a la orden del cliente.
texts.en: Orlando continues working in a convenience store he runs out of his home, as he and his wife work hard to keep making headway. She currently works as a part-time janitor, and they use this income to support their children, three of whom still live at home, while the other is in Costa Rica. The store has been growing, and introducing basic grains and snacks will be possible with more capital from a loan. With this new loan, he plans to purchase beans, rice, sugar, corn, snacks, drinks, personal-hygiene products and a display case to show off more products for his customers.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains and a display case.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues necesita iniciar su trabajo agrícola en la siembra de maíz y frijol, estos préstamos considera que son la herramienta necesaria para que puedan obtener los materiales como el abono y los herbicidas que le sirven para aplicarlos al cultivo y prevenir las plagas, por eso tomó la decisión de optar por este nuevo financiamiento que le ayude a comprarse los materiales necesarios.
El manifiesta que el crédito anterior le ayudó también en la compra de materiales, los cuales le fueron muy útiles para aplicarlos en el maíz y el frijol, logró recibir una cosecha sana y abundante de la cual se ha mantenido junto a su familia.
texts.en: Luis is requesting a new loan that he needs to start his farming business planting corn and beans. He considers these loans a necessary tool for him to get materials like fertilizer and herbicides to apply to his crops and prevent plagues, which is why he made the decision to request this new loan to help him purchase the materials he needs. He says that his previous loan also helped him buy materials, which were very useful for his corn and beans. He was able to secure a healthy and abundant harvest to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es:
La socia Gloria Luz sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN” y el banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Gloria Luz se sigue dedicando a la compra y venta de ropa para damas, la socia sgiue viajando a las diferentes ciudades ósea a las fábricas y trae todo tipo de ropa para damas como por ejemplo pantalones, blusas, casacas y otros prendas más. 

La socia Gloria Luz solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor para vender como por ejemplo pantalones, blusas, vestidos, chompas y otras más.

La socia Gloria Luz agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Gloria Luz continues to belong to the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank in the district of Arin, province of Calca, department of Cusco. She continues making a living buying and selling women's clothing, traveling to the factories in different cities and bringing back all kinds of women's clothing like pants, blouses, jackets and many more items. Gloria Luz is requesting this loan to purchase clothes like pants, blouses, dresses, sweaters and other items at wholesale. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothing like pants, blouses, dresses, sweaters and other items at wholesale.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is taking out another loan of Ksh 30,000 to expand his existing business. He plans to add to his stock of fruits and vegetables. The previous loan made him able to increase his monthly income which makes him think of opening a new business as soon as possible. Since the previous loan, his living standards have improved. Thanks to Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to add to his stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. Teresita also earns income from selling purified drinking water.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Patrick.  He has three siblings and is looking forward to getting married and starting his own family.  He runs a business of mobile money transfers in Kasama, a town located in the northern part of Zambia.  

Patrick grew up in Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia.  He relocated to the town of Kasama to start his own business in December 2011. In the short time that Patrick has run his business, he has managed to grow it from an average of eight customers a day, to thirty.  He believes that the Kiva loan will triple this number within a very short period of time, because it will mean his working capital will increase and he will never have to send away any customers that want to send and receive large amounts of money.  

His hopes and dreams are to see his business grow bigger and better.  In his own words, Patrick says he would like to have at least 80% of the people in his new community send and receive their monies through his business.  

Patrick is hopeful that once he has increased his working capital, he will be able to have even more customers and earn more profits.  The profits he says will put him in a good position to get married and start his own family.  

In the video, a representative of Mobile Transactions Zambia (MTZ) interviews Patrick

loans.use: To grow his business by increasing his working capital

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan would like to take another loan to buy more food to sell from her stall. Loan's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 59 years old and single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family by selling beverages in the local community, which she has done for 17 years. 

Em would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy a greater quantity of beverages to sell at higher margins. She hopes that through the loan, she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks,soap and beverages.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 46-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband earns a living working as a guard. Thu has been running a business sewing shoes for 10 years. 

Thu would like a loan to buy sewing materials and equipment. She hopes that the loan will help her business generate higher income and also will help her improve her family's living conditions. She also hopes to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and equipment.

loans.name: 18 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “18 DE MAYO” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de  Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Sipriana es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa y tejido de mantas de vicuña, salchipapas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, reciclaje de chatarra, venta de tucumanas, 
La señora Sipriana cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por su hermana; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de sus amigas.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su producto (compra de cortes de tela) los que comprarán de las ferias tradicionales de La Paz y posterior al tejido lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "18 de Mayo" (May 18th) is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Senkata Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by Sra. Sipriana as its president. The members of the group engage in different businesses such as selling clothing and woven blankets made of vicuña wool, making "salchipapas" (fried sausages and potatoes), selling food, managing a neighborhood store, recycling scrap metal, and selling turnovers.

Sra. Sipriana says that this is the first time she has joined a Communal Bank with Pro Mujer after being invited by her sister. She currently has a woven blanket business. Sipriana has been in this business for several years and learned this trade from her friends. The loan she is receiving now will be used to diversify her products (with pieces of pre-cut fabric) that she will buy at the traditional fairs of La Paz and then sell woven from her permanent stand. Working in this manner, enables her to move her family forward. Sipriana is in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sipriana said that she enjoys the health classes and the loans.

loans.use: to buy pre-cut fabrics.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 57 years old and single with one child.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Lucena has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending.

Lucena aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita. She previously took out a 15,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of sandals and slippers needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 17,000 loan for her to buy additional stocks of sandals and other footwear products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosita dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of sandals and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong was born in 1980. She has two children in her family. They are two little babies, a girl and a boy, who are staying at home. Her husband is a soldier. His salary is 3,000,000 VND per month. Phuong lives at home. She raises pigs and grows rice. She gets 4,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in the crediting program of SEDA since 2007. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,938,000 VND in order to enlarge her business and buy food for pigs

loans.use: to enlarge her business and buy food for pigs

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is a 38-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband earns a living working as a driver. Dieu supports her family by running a business selling meals in the local community, which she has done for 10 years. 

Dieu would like to take a loan to buy rice and foods for selling. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy rice and food to sell from her stall

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA RETAMA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Monica; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende chompas, polos, gorros, mantas y adornos, la socia tiene una tienda donde vende la artesanía desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, mantas, adornos y guantes.
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Monica is a member of the Communal Bank "La Retama", which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old, single, and has one child. Monica divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling handicrafts. She sells sweaters, pullovers, caps, blankets, and decorations. Monica has a shop where she sells handicrafts between the hours of 8am and 7pm. Through this business she is able to help her children get ahead. She dreams of expanding her handicraft business, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy crafts such as sweaters, blankets, decorations, and gloves.

Monica is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted sweaters, blankets, decorations, and gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Jose Faustino

texts.es:
José, se dedica siempre al sector agrícola, solicita un nuevo préstamo para iniciar la temporada en la siembra de maíz, para esto deberá comprarse los insumos agrícolas necesarios como el abono, semilla de maíz, pago de mozos, este préstamo será un gran aporte para que desarrolle este siempre.
Con el préstamo anterior logró realizar un cultivo muy productivo, ya que su cosecha fue abundante de la cual logró el sostenimiento de su familia y también ha logrado realizar algunas ventas a unos vecinos.
texts.en:
José has always dedicated himself to the agricultural sector.  He is requesting a new loan to start the corn-sowing season. In order to do this he will need to buy himself the necessary agricultural products such as fertilizer, corn seed, and to pay the workers.  This loan will serve as a great contribution so that he will always be able to develop in this sector.  

With the last loan he was was successful in obtaining a productive crop.  His cultivation was abundant and it helped him sustain his family.  He was also able to finalize some sales with a few of his neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, corn seeds, and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Jhovana Karen

texts.es: La Sra. Jhovana  tiene 21 años y es soltera con 1 hijos que  tiene la edad de un año, ella se dedica al comercio de carne en su carnicería que se encuentran en la zona  forestal,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jhovana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un congelador grande para conservar sus productos en buen estado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que requiere la congeladora para la venta de carne., la Sra. Jhovana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías en la zona, pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de otra congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jhovana, 21, is single and has a one-year-old son.  She sells meat at the butcher shop she runs in the forest area.  This is her first loan through the institution.  Jhovana plans to use the loan to buy a large freezer to keep the meat she sells.

One of the challenges Jhovana faces in her business is the competition from several butcher shops in the area.  But she has many customers because of her kindness and how she treats them.  The profits from the business will be used to buy another larger freezer.  Her goal is to have a stable, profitable business so she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a large freezer.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 32-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family by selling cellphone accessories, which she has done for seven years. 

Hang would like a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy a larger quantity of cellphone accessories to sell.  She hopes her business will run smoothly and that she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Shirly Cecilia

texts.es: Shirly es una mujer de 32 años que vive junto con su esposo y sus dos hijas de 3 y16 años en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno en el departamento de Bolívar.  Se dedica a la comercialización de calzado, sábanas, toallas, ropa exterior e interior, entre otros artículos.  Se inicia en esta actividad desde hace algunos años vendiendo sandalias por encargo entre sus amigos más cercanos, luego incursionó en la ropa interior y así poco a poco sus clientes fueron ampliando su demanda hasta tener hoy una variedad de artículos que ofrecer.  Vende a crédito principalmente, otorgando algunos plazos para el pago de la mercancía, es por esto que solicita su primer crédito Kiva con la entidad ya que desea tener capital de trabajo disponible para comprar mercancía en cualquier momento que le pidan y poder tener un stock de inventario. Ella conoce perfectamente el gusto de sus clientes y su idea es invertir teniendo en cuenta sus necesidades, esto es lo que le da la plena confianza de que su inversión será exitosa. Shirly tiene muchos sueños y está segura que con su esfuerzo los logrará, entre estos está tener un local propio donde pueda montar un almacén que le permita exhibir mejor su mercancía, obtener una rentabilidad mayor al 30%, porcentaje con el que trabaja hoy día, seguir contribuyendo en la educación de sus hijas hasta hacerlas unas profesionales y tener su casa propia.  Se considera una mujer activa, trabajadora, que se siente feliz con la actividad que desarrolla ya que con los ingresos que genera puede aportar para los gastos familiares y al crecimiento económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Shirly, 32, lives with her husband and two daughters, ages three and 16, in the town of San Juan Nepomuceno in the department of Bolívar.  She works selling shoes, sheets, towels, clothing and underwear, among other items.  Several years ago she started out selling sandals to her closest friends.  Then she began selling underwear and, little by little, her customers increased their demand to the point that now she sells a variety of articles.

She sells her goods mainly on a credit basis, so this first Kiva loan through the entity is to have enough work capital to buy the merchandise when she needs to and to keep an inventory.  She knows what her customers like and her idea is to purchase goods with them in mind, giving her the confidence to know her investment will be successful.  Shirly has many goals and is sure she will meet them through hard work.  One of them is to have her own shop where she can display her merchandise and reach a profitability margin greater than 30%, which is what she has now.  She also wants to continue providing her daughters with an education so they can become professionals and have their own houses.  She considers herself to be an active, hard-working person who is happy doing what she does, since she her income helps cover household expenses and contributes to family economic growth.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothing, underwear and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for maintenance and buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
Clara, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque iniciará una nueva cosecha de maíz, comprándose el abono, herbicidas y la semilla, también pagando la preparación del terreno y el despeine de la platanera Este prestarán ayuda a realizar la siembra también de pipián y plátano.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, obteniendo un buen resultado en la producción, esto le ha permitido mantener a su familia con el alimento necesario pues ha generado ingresos por la venta de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Clara is requesting a new loan because she wants to start a new crop of corn. She will buy compost, herbicides, and seeds. In addition, she will pay to have the land prepared for planting and her banana trees pruned. The loan will also help her begin planting pumpkins and bananas.

Clara says that her previous loan had a positive effect. She obtained good results from her production, which enabled her to provide food to sustain her family. Clara was able to generate needed income from the sale of her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and seeds.

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es: Sindy solicita su primer crédito kiva que le permita tener capital de trabajo disponible para  comprar mercancía como perfumes, talcos y artículos masculinos principalmente, para sus clientes que desean celebrar este mes dedicado a los padres.  Sindy es una mujer cartagenera de 31 años que reside en el Barrio Torices, dedicada hace un año a la venta de mercancía encargada por catálogos.  Todo empezó para ella cuando una sobrina suya, que al ver que quería tener una actividad que le generara ingresos con los que pudiera aportar a su núcleo familiar, la afilió a una reconocida marca que vende productos de tocador como perfumes, cosméticos, cuidado personal y bisutería, poco a poco fueron aumentando sus clientes entre los vecinos, amigos y referidos a tal punto que hoy en día Sindy desea organizarse mejor y más adelante montar una miscelánea con gran variedad de artículos.  Vende principalmente a crédito con plazos hasta de 30 y 45 días, tiempo en el cual recoge su cartera. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido trabajar con el poco capital que posee, ya que cada 21 días, de acuerdo a la modalidad de trabajo de este tipo de negocio, debe cancelar su factura para así acceder a un nuevo pedido de mercancía, hecho que algunas veces no contrasta con la forma de pago de sus clientes.  Vive en unión libre con su compañero permanente con el cual tiene dos hijos en edades de 8 y 11 años, a los que desea ver formados y ofrecerles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Sindy is requesting her first Kiva loan so she will have the working capital needed to buy merchandise such as perfumes, talcum powder and men's articles, mainly for her customers who want to celebrate Father's Day.  Sindy, 31, is from Cartagena and lives in the Torices Quarter.  For a year she has been selling goods by catalogue.  It all began when a niece of hers affiliated her with a well-known brand of perfume, cosmetics, personal care and jewelry products so she could generate her own income to help the family.  Little by little, she attracted more customers from among her neighbors, friends and referrals.  Now Sindy wants to organize herself better and in the future set up a shop with a large variety of items.

She sells mainly on a credit basis, with terms of 30  and 45 days.  One of her greatest challenges has been having to work with little capital, since every 21 days she must pay off one order in order to place another.  This does not always coincide with the customers' payment terms.  She lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages 8 and 11, for whom she wants to provide a good education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes, jewelry and other seasonal items for Father's Day.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es: Tal y como pretendía con su primer credikiva, Maritza invirtió en la compra de mercancía principalmente masculina como calcetines, ropa interior, entre otros artículos de miscelánea para surtir las vitrinas que posee en su negocio.  Con esto pudo capitalizarse, adquirir nuevos clientes y tal ha sido la acogida que le han solicitado que ofrezca servicios de internet; ella con el espíritu emprendedor que la caracteriza, decidió solicitar otro crédito para adquirir dos computadores y una impresora que le permita satisfacer la demanda de sus fieles clientes, confía que esta inversión va a incrementar sus ingresos y le dará otro aire al negocio por la diversificación en productos y servicios.  Maritza está muy agradecida con sus fondeadores por el apoyo que le han brindado con el crédito y espera seguir contando con el para su crecimiento como empresaria.
texts.en: Just as she had planned, Maritza invested her first Kiva loan in the purchase of merchandise, mainly men's socks, underwear and other items, to display in her shop.  This allowed her to earn work capital and acquire new customers that are now asking her to offer Internet services.  With the same entrepreneur spirit she is known for, she decided to request another loan to buy two computers and a printer to satisfy the demand of her loyal clients.  She trusts this investment will increase her income and giver her business another dimension in terms of products and services.  Maritza is very grateful to the lenders for this support and she hopes to continue growing as a business owner.

loans.use: To buy two computers and a printer to offer Internet services.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a guard.  Giau has been running her business of selling soft drinks in the local community for four years. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy a larger quantity of soft drinks to sell.

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of underwear and cosmetics from Avon and Natasha.

loans.name: Alethia

texts.en:
Alethia is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Alethia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store, where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has been running this business for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Alethia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Alethia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

NWTF is re-listing Fe's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, meat and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Gina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has been running this business for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan was born in 1977. She has two little daughters who are in kindergarten. Her husband and she sell construction materials to gain 8,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA since 2007. During the last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND within 50 weeks to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her construction supplies store

loans.name: Hamidc

texts.en:
Hamidc is 46 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Hamidc has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Hamidc has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed for resale, and will help Hamidc to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his two remaining kids. Hamidc hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children up to the higher level. 

Hamidc is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hamidc who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed for resale,

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une femme âgée de 39 ans, divorcée et mère de 02 enfants qui sont sont à la charge de son ex époux. elle a sous sa responsabilité 05 personnes parmi lesquelles sa maman. elle mène une activité de vente de la viande de brousse dans un marché de la ville depuis 02 ans. elle s'approvisionne dans un village de la region et conserve la marchandise au congélateur. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter un congélateur supplémentaire pour pouvoir conserver en grande quantité. elle compte avec les revenus générés diversifier davantage ses activités car parallèlement à la vente de viande elle vend également des vêtements.
texts.en:
Bernadette is 39 years old, divorced, and mother of two children who live with her ex-husband. She has five people living in her care, one of whom is her mother. 

She has been selling bushmeat at a market in town for two years now. She stocks up in a village in the same region, and conserves her goods in a freezer. 

She would like to buy an extra freezer with this loan so that she can conserve larger quantities of goods. With the revenue that she will earn, she plans to diversify her business, because in addition to bushmeat, she also sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 30 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children. For the past 3 years, Mwajuma has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Mwajuma has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh foods for cooking for resale, and will help Mwajuma to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Mwajuma hopes that in the future she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Mwajuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mwajuma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more fresh foods for cooking for resale

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Linh would like to take a further loan to buy more toys and beverages to sell from her stall. Linh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more toys and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sofia Anjum's Group

texts.en:
Sofia Anjum has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. He is a painter by profession, and paints walls and houses. His work is on a contract basis. People call him to paint their house and he gets good income once the contract is over. His customers are very satisfied with his good work and he has maintained a good reputation among them due to his work.

Sofia has two more children: her eldest son is a daily wage laborer while her daughter is studying in 9th standard (9th grade) and helps Sofia to manage household work after school.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transportation facilities to passengers.

With the loan investment, her son will purchase painting tools like brushes and ladders, etc. which will help him perform far better work and increase his income.

Sofia is very sure of his business success after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy paintbrushes and ladders for her son's painting business.

loans.name: Gefe

texts.en:
Gefe is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Gefe has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gefe became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Mary Rose has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mary Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Mary Rose hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Lakhena

texts.en:
Lakhena (pictured here) is 49 years old and her husband, Sokhom is 52 years old. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and they have five children--three sons and two daughters. One is married and lives separately, two are garment workers and the other two attend school. 

Lakhena sells soup and Chinese noodles in her village. Her husband assists his wife in the business. She is asking for a loan to expand the store where she sells soup and noodles because her shop is small. With the loan she will rebuild a bigger one. Lakhena will use a part of the loan to buy additional materials needed in her business such as chairs, plates, chopsticks, spoons and so on.

loans.use: To expand her store where she sells soup and Chinese noodles.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin. El socio Juan se sigue dedicándose a la agricultura osea tiene  terrenos de cultivo donde siembra por ejemplo maíz, papa y hortalizas. El socio Juan también se sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, conejos, pollos. En esta ocasión el socio Juan desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de  cuyes y pollos.

El socio Juan agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Juan still belongs to the “Virgen Concebida de Arin" communal bank. Juan is still working in agriculture. That is, he has cropland where he plants corn, potatoes and greens. Juan also is still raising small animals, such as guinea pigs, rabbits and chickens. At this time, Juan wants to invest the loan in buying guinea pigs and chickens.

Juan is thankful for the loan and committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La socia Máxima es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.

La socia Maxima nació en la ciudad de Calca departamento Cusco, Perú. Ella vive en los campos verdes de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y también le enseñaron a elaborar chicha de jora. Ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donde sirve la rica chicha de jora. 

En oportunidad Maxima requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz para hacer chicha de Jora.  

La socia Maxima agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Máxima is an enterprising and responsible woman who belongs to the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank.

Maxima was born in the city of Calca, departament of Cuzco, Perú. She lives in the green fields of the community of Arin, located in the Valle Sagrado of the Incas. Since she was very young, her parents taught her to work in agriculture and they also taught her to make chicha de jora. She has a small restaurant at her house where she serves the delicious chicha de jora. 

At this time, Maxima needs the loan to buy corn to make chicha de Jora.  

Maxima is thankful for the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn to make chicha de jora.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accesories and replacement parts for computers to sell

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Moung Russey district, Phea and her husband have been farming rice to support their family for five years. To make additional income, Phea also sells breakfast foods such as Chinese noodles soup, coffee and so on. Phea is 42 years old and has five dependent children, some of them are students while the others sell groceries. 

Phea's group consists of two members, both of whom have been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Now they are requesting the fourth loan after their third loan has successfully been repaid. 

As the leader, Phea will use her portion to buy fertilizers, seedlings and sacks for storing her rice crops. Through this loan, she hopes to make more good quality rice and therefore sell the crops for higher income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and sacks for storing rice.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years Jennifer has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry food like maize flour, and a milling machine. 

To help expand her business Jennifer has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize for milling for resale and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits. Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize for milling for resale.

loans.name: Leta

texts.en:
Leta is married with three young children ranging from eight to one years old and all her family live in a little village in Central Albania. It’s very unfortunate that her oldest child has never been sent to school because there is no school in the village. Families who are better off financially can pay for the school minibus. For Leta it was a luxury to send her daughter to school until now.

That being said, things are looking better for her lately. Her husband who has had the construction business for the past five years, and also her livestock business of four years, are doing so much better compared to before. She said,” things are looking up for my family now and I am very much happy at the moment.” She continued saying, “I’ve got plans now to send my daughter to school and she has been excited since she learned the news.”
