Leta has applied for her first loan through VisionFund Albania. She wants to add one more cow to increase the dairy products. She is seeking lenders‘ assistance in this matter and is promising them that she will pay off the loan without delay.

loans.use: to add one more cow to the existing herd.

loans.name: Musarat Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Musarat bibi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. He is a rickshaw driver by profession. He drives a rented rickshaw. He is very efficient in his work, but unfortunately he couldn’t earn as much as he expected because he can use the rented rickshaw for limited hours only, and in the end he has to share the earnings with the rickshaw owner. 

With the loan investment, her son will purchase a new rickshaw of his own which will enable him to drive it for longer hours and without any problem of sharing income.  Musarat is very confident about her son’s ability and she is very sure that the new rickshaw of his own will enable him to drive it with satisfaction, and as a result his income will be increased.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anthony Jerry

texts.en:
This is Anthony, 44, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Gina, a factory worker, and a father to his children. He, together with his wife and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anthony operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Anthony earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He also maintains a buy-and-sell business. He earns a minimum of Php 450 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Anthony hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Nympha

texts.en:
Nympha is 34 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Nympha has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for her chickens.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay for her family's medical expenses. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a grocery shop that sells sugar. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en:
Besnik is a thirty-three-year-old man from the Roma ethnic minority of Albania. He is married with three beautiful children who are twelve, eight and two and a half. He lives in a major city in Central Albania, where many people from his Roma community live. He considers himself as blessed because he has been given the opportunity to work for and assist his own people and “This is a privilege” he says, beaming. 

In the last ten years, Besnik has been running his own business in construction and has been doing very well. With some little savings and the first loan, he managed to buy a cement mixer. Now, he is requesting a second loan to buy building materials in large quantities, because the demand for his work is getting higher. 

To add here is that Besnik is getting some referrals from our dedicated staff branch as well. Just little marketing on the site to help him!  He is thanking each and every potential lender in advance.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of building materials.

loans.name: Paragogous Group

texts.en:
Paragogous is a group of seven females and one male with ages between 48 and 55 years and an average of four children who live in Teshie. They are between their first and fourth loans with ID-Ghana. 

These group members sell soft drinks, car spare parts, maize, plantains, yams, frozen food, cloth and fish.

Nora, the fat lady at the centre of the front row in the picture, is using her loan to buy four crates of Malta Guinness, four crates of Sprite and three crates of Coca-Cola. She buys her drinks from the depot and sells them at the central market in Accra. She expects to earn 80 GHS monthly, which she will use to support family expenses and for reinvestment.
 
The group needs a total of 4,750 GHS.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is 38 years old, married, and the mother of a 4-year-old daughter. She is a great mother and a very caring wife who supports her husband financially by sewing clothes and doing embroidery for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month.

Her husband has a job in an organization. His income is not enough for the whole family, and that’s why Azra started her business a few years ago. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her business. With the loan investment she will buy some embroidery materials that will allow her to provide better services and products to her clients and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy beads and thread for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh meat to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie est une camerounaise âgée de 46 ans, célibataire et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 21 et 30 ans; ceci dire ses enfants sont tous majeurs. elle dispose de deux autres personnes sous sa responsabilité. comme activité, elle a un restaurant spécialisé dans la vente de poisson braisé et boissons depuis 12 ans. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine, ce qui lui a permis d'avoir une clientèle fidèle et importante en terme de nombre dans la mesure où elle parvient à écouler un carton de poisson par jour. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 07 cartons de poissons et 20 casiers de boissons hygiéniques pour mettre en stock afin d'éviter toute rupture. 
Ses ambitions pour sa famille seraient de construire une maison en matériaux définitifs pour mieux assurer sa sécurité
texts.en:
Marie is a 46-year-old Cameroonian lady.  She is single and the mother of three children who are between 21 and 30 years of age, which is to say that all of her children are now adults.  Marie has two other people in her care.

Marie's business is a restaurant where she sells grilled fish and drinks.  She has had this restaurant for 12 years.  She has good experience in her field and so has a large number of loyal customers.  She manages to get through a box of fish a day.  Marie would like to use this loan to buy seven boxes of fish and 20 crates of soda for her business so that she can avoid experiencing a break in her stock.  

Marie's ambitions for her family are to build a house from permanent materials so that she can guarantee their security.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish

loans.name: Akwadu Group

texts.en:
This is a community based group called Akwadu (banana), with eight females and two males. They are all married. The average age in this group is 44 years. They are in their third loan cycle and are selling the following products: fishing equipment, bread, cloth, firewood, cassava, fish, provisions, fishing net and cooking utensils.

Comfort, second from right in the front row of the picture, is the leader. She sells cloth. She buys her goods from the central market at Accra. She will buy two bills of goods which will be sold in the Teshie community. Her goal is to expand her business and build a house of her own.

The group needs an amount of 3,550 GHS.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell, like milk fish and sardines.

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena is very active lady. She is 29 years old and a mother of 5 children. All of her children are enrolled in the local school and getting their education.
Her husband has a business of making and selling shoes. He gets orders from different shoe-selling shops and factories and completes their orders on time to earn an income.

Meena is a housewife who remains at her home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because her husband has a large order to fulfill. With the loan investment he will buy leather and shoelaces in bulk quantities to be able to complete that order.
He has been operating his business for the past many years and Meena is confident that the loan will be a productive one for him and bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy leather and laces for a shoe-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is 37 years old. She has three children. They are all little. She has a small breakfast stall in the market. She earns 4,500,000 VND a month. She has been participating in SEDA's programs since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid that loan on time. For this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to expand her business. Then, she hopes that her business will get enough money so that she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad, the leader of this group, has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who operates a mobile phones shop in the market.

With the loan investment, he will buy the latest models of mobile phones as well as accessories and repairing tools for the expansion of his business.

He has been operating his business for some time now and Shamshad is confident that the loan investment will help him attract more clients and increase his sales and income.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones, accessories and repairing tools.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is a 58-year-old divorcee with four children. She is hard-working, creative and very innovative.

Annette makes crafts that she sells at crafts village, a popular place in Kampala where tourists buy African attire. She has been doing this business since 2002 after a friend who knew her interest in African craft recommend it.

Annette's clients are mostly tourists and the corporate community. The business has helped her and her family to survive in the city where the cost of living is high. 

She wants UGX 1,500,000 to buy materials that she will use to make African jewelery to sell.

Her main challenge is riots and chaos in the city, which hinder tourists from coming into the country.

loans.use: To buy materials to make African jewelery.

loans.name: Pape Amadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape Amadou vit au Sénégal. Il s’active depuis 14 ans dans le commerce et la vente de pièces détachées. Il consacre  10 ans de temps de la journée dans son activité de commerce. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées a commercialiser. Il souhaite développer son activité et élargir le nombre de ses employés a 4, accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants et enfin épargner de l’argent. Son rêve   est de devenir un grand commerçant  en automobiles.
texts.en: Pape Amadou lives in Senegal.  He has been buying and selling auto parts for 14 years.  He spends 10 hours a day working in his business.  He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan for 300,000 francs to buy auto parts to sell.  He would like to make progress in his business, increase his number of employees to four, and increase his profits so that he can better cover his children's school fees and save some money.  His dream is to become an important car salesman.

loans.use: to buy auto parts to re-sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. Donde un grupo de vecinos formaron el Banco Comunal  “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.

La socia Matilde desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron la venta de verduras y también a la crianza de animales menores y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran vegetales y hortalizas como por ejemplo culantro, perejil, orégano y otras vegetales. La socia Matilde también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y patos. El crédito que ha solicitado será destinado para comprar más semillas. La socia Matilde es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in Cusco department, there is a community called Arin.  This place is known for its beautiful landscape, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.  Here a group of neighbors formed a community bank called 'Virgen Concebida de Arin'.

One of the bank's members, Matilde, was taught by her parents to sell vegetables and raise animals from a very young age.  Now she has her own farmland where she works together with her partner.  With a great deal of care, they sow vegetables and herbs such as cilantro (coriander), parsley, oregano and others.  Matilda also raises animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs and ducks.  She will use the loan that she has requested to buy more seeds.  Matilde is a hard-working, tenacious woman who has always known how to make progress, improve her life and get what she wants.

loans.use: to buy more seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom, 32, is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

Kalsoom's husband has a stamp papers sales business while Kalsoom is involved in a sewing and embroidery business. She is a very talented business woman. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, and that helps attract many more customers. 

Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will purchase embroidery material and sketches in larger quantity so that she can make the latest fashion in embroidery designs. She will also buy a new sewing machine, which will enable her to produce better quality work and satisfy her customers.
 
She is hopeful about her business's further growth after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material and sketches and a new sewing machine for her sewing and embroidery business.

loans.name: Rose Chaterine

texts.en: Rose Chaterine is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Rose Chaterine has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rose Chaterine has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future,Rose Chaterine hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks,soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man of 40 years. He has 4 children in addition to 3 dependents who are orphans. He takes care of all their needs in addition to paying school fees.
Robert has been trading in timber since 1998. He has been able  to build  a rental room out of the same.
He works all the days of the week so that he can maximise profits and be able to meet the many demands of his family. His major clientele is the local community.
He is asking for UGX 2,500,000 to buy more timber to sell to boost his income.
His dream is to build more rental rooms such that he is able to increase his income to meet his many family demands. His good customer relations have enabled him to retain many customers.
Robert is a very hard working and honest  man.

loans.use: to buy more timber to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto  de 39 años de edad trabaja para el Juzgado desde hace 4 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, además este cliente cuenta con un negocio propio como es una funeraria  ubicada en la zona # 1 para  comprarle 2 libros a su hijo que actualmente esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad Martin Lutero, Cesar se caracteriza por ser excelente cliente y muy responsable con sus compromisos crediticios, su sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios y gozen de salud.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 39 years of age, and has worked for the court for the past four years. He is very responsible and honest, and also has his own business, a funeral parlor located in the most important zone.  

Cesar Agusto wants to buy two books for his son who is currently studying a law degree at Martin Lutero University. Cesar is an excellent client who is very responsible when it comes to his loan commitments. His dream is to see his children complete their university education and have good health.

loans.use: To buy books.

loans.name: Aristides M

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. Donde un grupo de vecinos formaron el Banco Comunal  “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.

El socio Aristides es maestro carpintero, el tiene su pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica muebles de madera como por ejemplo roperos, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Posteriormente vende sus muebles a personas que le hicieron pedidos hace tiempo. El crédito que ha solicitado el socio Aristides será destinado para la compra de materiales como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero y lijas. 

El socio Aristides es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in Cusco department, there is a community called Arin.  This place is known for its beautiful landscape, its cuisine, and the warmth of its people.  Here a group of neighbors came together to create the 'Virgen Concebida de Arin' community bank.

Aristides is a member of this group.  He is a master carpenter and has a small workshop in his home where he makes pieces of wooden furniture such as wardrobes, chairs, tables, etc.  He has been in this business for a number of years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  When he has finished making his pieces of furniture, he sells them to people who have already placed orders with him.  He will use the loan that he has requested to buy materials such as wood, carpenter's glue and sandpaper.

Aristides is a hard-working, tenacious man who has always known how to make progress, improve his life and get what he wants.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, carpenter's glue and sandpaper

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a very efficient and hardworking lady. She owns and operates a sewing and embroidery business out of her home. She receives orders regularly from her neighboring customers. In this way, she earns an income for her family.  

Kosar is the mother of five children, including three sons and two daughters. All of her children are going to school. Kosar and her husband want their children to get a good education so their future will be bright. 

Kosar's husband has a vegetable sales business. He gets up early in the morning to purchase vegetables from the vegetable market and then he sells them on his donkey cart by visiting different areas. 
 
With the loan investment, Kosar's husband will purchase vegetables in a larger quantity to add to his cart for selling. She will also invest some of the loan amount to buy sewing and embroidery materials. In this way, they will both be able to grow their businesses and improve their family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and sewing/embroidery materials.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
This is George, 39, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Melinda. He is a father of two children. the elder is in elementary level while the younger is not yet of school age. At this time, he is working hard to meet their financial expenses.

George operates a retailing business. He buys his products from wholesalers and sells them per piece with a little profit. His products are mineral water and LPG tanks. These products are basic needs in his area. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy additional supplies of mineral water and LPG tanks needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

George hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of mineral water and LPG tanks needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. 

Two years ago, Fatuma started a charcoal and firewood sales business from her home. Her customers are her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma cites the high cost of transportation as a major challenge in her business. She needs capital in order to increase her stock of charcoal and firewood. This is  why she is requesting a loan. 

Fatuma is grateful to Yehu Microfinance Trust for the support offered through the loan. It will provide lots of help to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 48 years old. He lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two beautiful children.
 
Reynaldo owns a piggery that grows and sells mature pigs. He has had this piggery business for 10 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 40,000 to expand the piggery and buy more feeds, vaccines and medicines and to use for the over all maintenance of the business.
 
Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his business so that he can provide all the needs of his children, especially shelter, food and education.

loans.use: To expand the piggery and buy more feeds, vaccines and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has two children. For the past six years, Zaina has been working hard to manage her charcoal sales business. 

To help expand her small business, Zaina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale. This will help Zaina generate greater profits. Zaina hopes she will be able to open another charcoal sales store in the future.

Zaina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zaina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is 26 years old. She has one child. Each month she gets about 4,000,000 VND from her small CD/DVD store. Lien has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow about 9,184,000 VND to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her CD/DVD business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the kitchen the family owns.

Aziza is a 55-year-old woman, who is married and the mother of two sons and three daughters. For the past four years, Aziza and her family have had a kitchen for making traditional Palestinian food upon customers' request, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for Aziza and her family.

Aziza is requesting a $2,000 loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing necessary kitchen tools and main ingredients, such as flour, rice, and cooking oil. This will enable Aziza to offer the customers' requests on time, which will increase her production and sales and so improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen tools and staple ingredients so she can cook food for sale.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang is 50 years old. All of her three children are married. She has a small grocery store to support her old weak husband and herself. It brings in 3,000,000 VND per month for her. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her general store.

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.en: Gaybullo has worked for 15 years on a collective farm. He grows potatoes and sells them to local people. Gaybullo is a hard-working man and always tries to raise his products with high quality. The potatoes he grows are very tasty. He is married and has a child. His wife helps him in his business. Gaybullo earns additional income by selling cattle and other animals. He is a very motivated businessman. His aim is to buy more livestock.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Loyda

texts.en:
This is Loyda, 51, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nelson, a mechanic, and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Loyda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Loyda hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Naida

texts.es: Naida es una mujer cartagenera de 58 años de edad que desde muy niña se trasladó con sus padres desde su ciudad natal a la vecina ciudad de Barranquilla.  Vive en el barrio Siete de Abril donde se dedica desde hace tres años al comercio de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y de perfumes.  Con el crédito solicitado quiere comprar principalmente jeans, perfumes e incursionar en el calzado, ya que cuenta con clientes fijos que le han hecho encargos con anterioridad.  Desde los  14 años sabe lo que es trabajar, empezó como empleada del servicio doméstico en una casa de familia, lo que le impidió terminar sus estudios de bachiller, sin embargo, sus padres siempre le enseñaron buenas costumbres y a trabajar para conseguir lo que quería.  Cuando tenía 23 años se une al hombre con el que vive actualmente en unión libre, este es voceador de periódicos ambulante y de cuya unión nacen sus tres hijos, hoy mayores de edad.  Es una familia unida y se colaboran entre sí para solventar los gastos familiares.  Naida aún labora como empleada del servicio y sus principales clientes son empleados como vigilantes de edificios cercanos a donde labora, al igual que compañeras de oficio, estos le hacen encargos de la mercancía y le cancelan quincenalmente cuando cuando reciben su salario.  No teme al hacer la inversión, ya que hasta la fecha con sus clientes le ha ido muy bien y la cercanía con ellos le permite una recuperación efectiva de la cartera.  Su principal sueño es mudarse a una casa grande donde pueda albergar a toda su familia.  Naida es una mujer luchadora que no se le amedranta a nada, considera que todo lo que emprende le sale bien y hasta el momento no ha tenido ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Naida, 58 years old, is a woman from Cartegenia. At a very young age, she moved with her parents from her birth city to the neighboring city of Barranquilla. She lives in the Siete de Abril neighborhood where, for the past 3 years, she has made a living by selling clothes for women, men, and children, in addition to perfume. 

With this requested loan, she wants to buy mainly jeans and perfumes, and also venture into shoe sales since her regular customers have made shoe orders. For 14 years, Naida knows what it means to work. She began as a domestic service employee in a family home. This prevented her from completing her high school studies. However, her parents always taught her good habits and how to work in order to achieve what she wanted.

When she was 23 years old, she was united with the man she currently lives with in a common law marriage. He is a traveling newspaper vendor. From their marriage, they have three children, who are now adults. They have a close family and they work together to pay the household expenses. Naida still works as a service employee and her main customers are employed as security guards at buildings near where she works. Some customers are also office workers, who make merchandise orders and then pay for them every two weeks when they receive their paychecks. She is not afraid of making this type of investment since, thus far, everything has gone very well with her customers and the closeness to them allows her an effective profit. 

Her main dream is to move into a large house that can accommodate her whole family. Naida is a hard-working woman who is not afraid of anything. She thinks that everything that she has set out to do has gone well and up to this point, she has not had any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy jeans and perfumes, and to venture into shoe sales

loans.name: Rashida Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Rashida bibi is 44 years old, married, and has six children. All of her kids are boys. Besides her eldest son the other are getting their education from a nearby school. 

Rashida herself is a caring housewife who manages the household and works by staying at home. She loves to take care of her family. She prepares good and tasty food for her family and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to them by fulfilling their needs. 

Rashida's husband has a food stall in the community where he serves his customers samosas (a Punjabi food item prepares with flour and filled with potatoes, served with sweets and yogurt). His samosas are very famous among his community and he makes good sales every month. Rashida also helps him  make samosas for his stall. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. He will invest the loan in buying ingredients such as potatoes, cooking oil, spices etc. for preparing samosas in larger quantities. 

She is very hopeful about her husband's business growth after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy material for producing samosas (a Punjabi food item)

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is from the Akhmeta District of East Georgia. He lives with his family in his village house: his wife Manana, a 19-year-old son, and a 12-year-old daughter. Zakaria requested loans from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and the family's poor living conditions. 

Zakaria is an agricultural worker in the village and earns on average 100 Laris per month. His wife works as a nanny in the local kindergarten. The total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zakaria requested an agricultural loan from Credo for starting a small-scale agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to  rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, and who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the loan Zakaria will purchase calves. He will grow them and after a year, when the cows start giving milk, he will start producing traditional Georgian cheese. Zakaria and Manana will sell the cheese on the local open market. They have experience in running a dairy farm, as they used to run one, but five years ago the family stopped the business, and sold the cows, as they urgently needed money. 

The purchased calves will be placed in the old cattle-shed, located in their yard. They will move the grass and prepare hay for feeding the calves in the winter months. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented through the Kiva loan the family's income will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves for the start-up of a dairy farm

loans.name: Kodir

texts.en:
Kodir is the most hard-working son in his family. His father was very glad when 20 years ago he chose the profession which had more benefit for his life. Kodir works in a collective farm and nowadays grows corn and other agricultural products. Kodir also has livestock in the house. He sells meat, milk and agricultural products. 

He is married and has four beautiful children. Kodir tries to comfort them with all things which they need. Kodir wants to repair his house to improve the family's living conditions. His aim is to buy building materials.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 26 years old. He is single. He has spent five years in the business of selling sweaters and shirts. With the loan, he will buy more shirts and sweaters. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and sweaters for resale.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat chose this business which is very familiar among her people. She raises potatoes and wheat. If you want to eat the most tasty potatoes then you must buy  them from Sharofat. The wheat grown by Sharofat  also has high quality. 

Sharofat isn’t satisfied only with growing vegetables. She also has added income from selling livestock. She is married to a driver. Sharofat’s husband helps her in the business. She is a mother of three smart children. Her aim is to buy seed for growing potatoes.

loans.use: To buy seed

loans.name: Rowieda

texts.en:
Rowieda is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured next to his taxi.

Rowieda is a 38-year-old woman; she is married and a mother to one son and one daughter. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past four years, Rowieda's husband has also been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Rowieda is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband complete the price of purchasing a new taxi instead of the old one which has become unusable. This will enable Rowieda's husband to work extra hours and improve the family's income.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To change the old taxi and complete the price of new one

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s molding business. With the loan investment, he will buy a molding machine to offer better quality services to his clients and improve his income. He is very skilful and has great technical knowledge about his work. He molds iron and makes different iron products that way.

Nasira is confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business by investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy molding machine for molding business

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en: Jean Baptiste is a father of four children aged between four and twelve years; all of his children are enrolled in school. He sells clothes and he has been in the business for the past 10 years. With the loan, he will buy more shirts, trousers and suits to sell. He plans to reinvest the profits in the business for better expansion.

loans.use: To buy more shirts, trousers and suits to sell.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
A loan group from Pho Cho town, Yen Phong commune, Bac Ninh province has three women. The leader is Mrs Huong. She is 24 years old. She got married and has two children. One is in primary school, the other is still really little. 

She has a small electrical goods store. Normally, she makes from this store 3,000,000 Dong (VND) per month. She has taken part in the loan program of SEDA since 2011. For her last loan, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid it on time. For this loan, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to enlarge her business. 

Mrs Phuong is 36 years old. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND.

Mrs Phuc is 29 years old. She sells CDs/DVDs for a living. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods for sale

loans.name: Lhagvaa

texts.en:
Lhagva, 53 years old, lives with her husband and a son in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her son is a cab driver. She started her agriculture business in 1999. She owns 0.5 acres of land. She plants potatoes. Her business income is not sufficient enough to support her family. 

In order to generate more income, she needs to expand her business. Therefore, she needs to buy a greenhouse to expand her business, so that she can support her family. According to her calculation, her income will increase 35% by purchasing a greenhouse. She said, " My husband and I have worked for our son's future.  I like to be busy. Now I would like to grow vegetables in a greenhouse." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy a greenhouse.

loans.use: To buy a greenhouse

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie. She previously took out a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 


Julie hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 42 years old. She is a mother of five children. She has been selling beans and sugar for eight years. She has requested a loan to buy more beans, onions, potatoes, rice and sugar to sell. With the profits from the business she will pay school fees for the children. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, onions, potatoes and rice to sell.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Mrs Hanh is 33 years old. She has two children. She has a small CD/DVD store in Pho Cho town. 3,000,000 VND is her earnings each month. She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid that loan on time. In this cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to support her business.

loans.use: to buy more discs for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 60 años de edad, pero su espíritu y su alegría es de una joven de 20 años, ya que ella nos comenta que la vejes se lleva solo por fuera porque si eres joven por dentro la edad queda de lado, ella es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que tiene un clima muy cálido y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, pallares, paprika, entre otros, se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, la cual es  muy visitada en todo el año por infinidad de turistas. A Rosa le gusta mucho su trabajo, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “Tallarines Verdes”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera Universitaria.

Día a día Rosa trabaja en su negocio de venta de Calzados puerta a puerta, ella trabaja por las mañanas y por las tardes y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y sobre todo a precios cómodos.

Rosa esta muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar zapatos y botas para ofrecer en su negocio ya que estamos en época de invierno y podrá tener más variedad de productos, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y sobre todo seguir adelante en búsqueda de cumplir su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old. Her spirit and happiness is like that of a young 20 year old. She tells us that she’s only old on the outside because if you’re young on the inside, your age stays on the side. She is very enthusiastic and hard-working. Her home is located in the city of Ica. The city has a very mild climate. It is known for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of grapes, asparagus, butter beans, and paprika, among other crops. The Huacachina Lake is located here. It is well visited all year by lots of tourists. Rosa likes her work a lot but when she has a little free time, she likes to prepare one of her favorite recipes which are delicious “Tallarines Verdes” (noodles with Peruvian green sauce). Due to little access to financial recourses, she could only study until the fifth grade of secondary school but she would have liked to earn a university degree. 

Day by day, Rosa works selling shoes door to door. She works in the morning and in the afternoon. She can see up to ten customers a day. She believes that her business is going well because she offers quality products and more than anything, comfortable prices.

Rosa is very happy and is grateful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have offered she will be able to purchase shoes and boots to offer in her business. It is now winter and she will need to have more variety of products. She will improve her earnings and her quality of life which will allow her to continue working and more than anything, continue moving forward with her search to fulfill her biggest dream of completing the construction of her own home.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (shoes and boots).

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: La Sra. Elvia tiene 22 años y es soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de madera, ella administra su aserradero que se encuentran en la zona Villazon, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elvia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de troncos por su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir la madera que necesita, Elvia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la  competencia ya que existe muchos aserraderos por la zona, y ella  quiere tener cantidad de madera para ofrecer a su clientela y así de esta manera aumentar su producción y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  madera y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable, la Sra. Elvia es una persona joven emprendedora con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Elvia is 22 years old and single. She sells wood and manages a sawmill that is located in the District of Villazon. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender.

Sra. Elvia will use this loan to buy logs for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she does not have enough money to acquire the wood that she needs. Elvia faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition that exists among the many sawmills in the area. She wants to continue buying wood and improving her income. Her wish is to have a stable and profitable business. Sra. Elvia is an enterprising young woman who desires to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy logs.

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio de la merienda, pues considera que le hacen falta materiales para poder realizar sus productos de la mejor manera, se comprará maíz, leña, gas, condimentos y  otros materiales necesarios para preparar la comida.
Ella espera con este préstamo tener buenos resultados de la misma manera que los consiguió con el préstamo anterior, ya que ha mantenido variedad de sus productos y de esta manera ha logrado salir adelante estos meses con su familia, pues considera que sus ventas han aumentado.
texts.en:
Ruth is requesting a new loan to invest in her snack business. She considers her venture to be lacking in supplies that are needed to put forth a better product. Ruth will buy corn, firewood, gas, condiments, and other necessary supplies for preparing her food.

She hopes that this loan will generate good results in the same manner as her previous one. By maintaining a variety of products, Ruth will be able to move forward with her family in the coming months. She believes her sales have increased.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas, and condiments.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. Donde un grupo de vecinos formaron el Banco Comunal  “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.

Josefa se dedica a la venta de verduras y también a crianza de animales menores y ella vende en diferentes mercados de los diferentes ciudades como Calca, Urubamba y Cusco. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, maíz y otras vegetales. El crédito que ha solicitado Josefa será destinado para comprar más semillas. Josefa es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, department of Cusco, there is a place known as the community of Arin. This location is known for it beautiful vistas, its gastronomy, and the quality of its people. This is where a group of residents formed the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” [Virgin Who Conceived of Arin] Communal Bank.

Josefa dedicates her time to selling vegetables and, also, to raising small livestock. She sells her production in various markets of different cities, including Calca, Urubamba, and Cusco.  Since she was small, her parents taught her this work and now, she has her own lands which she farms with her spouse, and where, with much care, they sow vegetables, principally potatoes and corn, plus other vegetables.

The loan Josefa has requested will be used to buy more seeds. Josefa is a hard-working and careful woman who has always known how to get ahead, to improve her life, and to be able to obtain what she wants.

loans.use: to buy more seeds to plant.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: As a hard-working woman, Nasiba likes to be busy with useful work  for herself. For 10 years she has been working at the collective farm. Nasiba grows onions, cucumbers, peas and other agricultural produce. She sells vegetables to local people. Her goods have many consumers. Nasiba’s skill helps  to finish perfectly all her deals. She is married and has five children. Nasiba is as good with her family as in business. Her aim is to buy mineral fertilizers for a plot of land in which she works.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Madame Marguerite est une femme mariée qui habite au Sénégal  et s’active depuis 6 ans dans le commerce de boissons.  Elle consacre 14 heures de temps dans la journée a son activité. Elle est membre  d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de boissons qui seront destinés  à renforcer  son stock actuellement disponible dans son local. Son objectif consiste à accroitre les revenus que lui procure son activité afin de pouvoir employer une personne qui pourra le  seconder dans  son activité, payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et aussi épargner de l’argent. Son projet futur est de disposer d’une grande boutique de  boissons et pratiquer la vente  en gros et demi gros.
texts.en:
Marguerite is a married woman who lives in Senegal. For the past six years she has worked selling drinks. She works in her business for 14 hours per day.

Marguerite is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC. She has requested a loan of 500,000 francs to buy drinks, which will increase the stock she currently has available in her premises. Her goal is to increase the revenues she generates from her business, so that she can employ someone to help her with the business, pay her children's education expenses, and save some money. In the future she would like to have a large drinks store, and to sell wholesale to both retailers and the public.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale

loans.name: Bladimir Alfonso

texts.es: Bladimir es un hombre de 34 años de edad que ofrece el servicio de internet, fotocopiadora, video juegos y venta de confitería en un local que tiene arrendado en la calle principal del Barrio Santa María de Barranquilla.  Solicita su primer crédito Kiva ya que desea comprar dos televisores, dos consolas de video juego, sillas, monitores tipo LED y cámaras para ofrecer un mejor servicio a su exigente clientela que poco a poco ha ido aumentando.  Bladimir adquiere experiencia en este tipo de negocio cuando en el año 1997, al culminar sus estudios de bachillerato, decide iniciar estudios como Tecnólogo en Sistemas.  Simultáneamente consigue un empleo como ayudante en construcción de ventanas en aluminio, así se sostuvo y pudo terminar sus estudios técnicos.  Para darle aplicación a lo que estudió con gran esfuerzo, comienza a trabajar en varias empresas privadas como soporte tecnológico lo que le animó a montar su propio negocio con lo que había producido y ahorrado en sus trabajos.  Inició el negocio hace 4 años sólo con el servicio de internet en un local alquilado y tal ha sido su éxito que poco a poco le ha ido incluyendo los demás servicios.  Es un negocio muy rentable, sus costos son bajos, vende de contado y a diario, por la gran proyección que tiene es que ha decidido realizar la inversión en activos fijos para darle una mayor estructura y estar a la vanguardia de la tecnología.  Bladimir vive en unión libre y hasta el momento no ha tenido hijos, su compañera estudia contaduría pública en las noches, ya que en el día le colabora con la atención del negocio.  Es un hombre muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de progresar, actualmente se encuentra realizando una especialización en redes informáticas y su mayor sueño es legalizar ante alguna autoridad la relación con su compañera  y tener hijos.
texts.en: Bladimir, 34, sells Internet, copying and video-game services in a store that he rents on a main street in the Santa Maria neighborhood of Barranquilla.  He is applying to Kiva for a loan that he will use to buy two televisions, two video-game consoles, chairs, LED displays and video cameras so that he can provide his customers with new and better services.  Bladimir completed a degree in Systems Technology in 1997.  He was working in construction, installing aluminum windows, to support himself and pay his university fees.  He then worked for various private companies as a support technician before deciding to start his own business.  He started the business 4 years ago, selling Internet services.  He made good progress and slowly added the other services and products that he now sells.  His tells us that the business is profitable, that his costs are low and that he only deals in cash.  He is investing in "activos fijos" (not sure in this context) in order to firm up his business structure and stay at the forefront of technology.  Bladimir lives with his partner, who is studying for a degree in Public Accounting.  The couple has no children.  Bladimir is an enterprising man who wants to get ahead.  He is currently completing a course in information networks.  For the future, he wants to marry his partner and have children.

loans.use: to buy computers and other equipment for his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Don Luis, sigue con su comercio de venta de granos basicos al por mayor, el cual traslada en su mismo transporte un camion, en donde compra y vende,  tiene ya sus compradores, lo que se le hace mas facil sus ventas, estos granos basicos los compra en el departamento de Jinotega  a menor costos, en donde se cultivan estos productos por ser tierras fertil, y con mucho agua, asi mismo,ha aumentado la cantidad en compra de granos, al hacer financiamiento en Afodenic, trabajando con mas capital. tambien hace acarreo en su camion, teniendo esta entrada fija.
Con este nuevo prestamo podra comprar 23 quintales de frijoles rojos, 48 quintales de maiz blanco, logrando cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, ya que solo va entregar el producto.generandole buenas ganancias para cubrir sus gastos personales como sus compromisos de pago.
texts.en:
Don Luis continues with his business as a wholesaler of basic grains. He uses a truck to transport his products to wherever he buys and sells. Luis already has buyers so he is able to generate sales easily. He buys his products at low cost in the Department of Jinotega, where these crops are cultivated on fertile land and with plenty of water. As a result, he is able to buy these products in increased quantities. By taking out a loan with AFODENIC, Luis is able to work with more capital. In addition, he has a truck to use for transport and an established entrance into the marketplace.

With this new loan, Luis will be able to buy 23 quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of red beans and 48 quintals of white corn so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers. He will deliver the products by himself. By generating good profits, Luis will be to cover his personal expenses and his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy red beans and white corn.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. Donde un grupo de vecinos formaron el Banco Comunal  “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.

Justina se dedica a la venta de verduras y también elaborar jora de maíz y vende en diferentes mercados de los diferentes ciudades como Calca, Urubamba y Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El crédito que ha solicitado Justina será destinado para pagar a los ayudantes que le ayudaran a desgranar el maíz. Justina es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in the departamento of Cusco, there's a place called Arin.  The place is known for its pretty surroundings, its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.  It's here that you will find the Virgin Concebida de Arin community bank.

Justina operates a business selling vegetables.  She also makes and sells a traditional food called jora de maiz.  She operates the business in markets in Calca, Urubamba and Cusco.  She has operated the business for several years now and says that it's successful because of the hard work that she commits to it.  Justina will use this loan to pay laborers to help process maize for her food business.  She is a hard-working woman who only wants to support herself and get ahead inthe world.

loans.use: to pay laborers to help process maize.

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en: Tharcisse is 55 years old and the father of four children who range in age from 10 to 20 years old. All of his children are enrolled in school. He earns a living by selling materials which cobblers use to make shoes, and is requesting a loan to buy advanced equipment for making shoes. With the profits from his business, he wants to renovate his house, which was damaged by heavy rain.

loans.use: to buy more more advanced shoe-making equipment.

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune est un commerçant  sénégalais qui  évolue dans la vente de sucre depuis 9 ans. Elle consacre 8 heures de temps dans la journée à son activité. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour acheter du sucre destiné a la vente pour les besoins de son commerce. Son objectif est renforcer  son fond de roulement,  d’augmenter  ses bénéfices pour prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants et aussi d’épargner  de l’argent pour ses projets futurs. Son intention est de stabiliser et renforcer d’avantage son commerce de sucre.
texts.en: Mr. Alioune is a Senegalese entrepreneur who has been selling sugar for nine years. [He] spends eight hours a day on his work. He is a member of the U-IMCEC and is seeking a credit of 250,000 West African francs in order to buy sugar for resale, as his business needs stock. His goal in to bolster his working capital and increase his revenues in order to cover the education costs for his children and also to save money for future projects. His intention is to stabilize and grow his sugar business.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Visentina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. Donde un grupo de vecinos formaron el Banco Comunal  “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.

La socia Visentina desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron la actividad de la agricultura y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja, que con mucho esmero siembran maíz. Ella también se dedica a la crianza animales menores. Ella nos cuenta que comprar ganado de la feria de Inquilpata y los hace engordar y después vienen a su casa carniceros para comprar su ganado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de aledañas. En esta oportunidad Visentina requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in the departamento of Cusco, there's a place called Arin. The place is known for its pretty surroundings, its cuisine and for the warmth of its people. It's here that you will find the Virgin Concebida de Arin community bank.
 
Our member, Visentina, started working on farms when she was just a girl.  She grows maize on her own farm now.  She also raises and sells animals.  She tells us that she buys the animal at a market in Inquilpata and fattens them for sale.  When they're old enough, she sells them to a butcher.  Her favorite thing about her business is harvesting her crop because that's when all her hard work pays off.  She has operated the business for many years and tells us that her biggest challenge is transporting her crop away from the farm to the towns where she has to store it.  Visentina will use this loan to buy pigs for her animal sales business.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Gundtsamba

texts.en: Gundtsamba, 41, lives with his wife and four children in a ger (or traditional Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His older daughter is a college student, two of his children are secondary school students and his youngest child stays at home. Gundtsamba started a shoe-production business in 2005, and makes traditional shoes with his wife. He also raises livestock, and has a herd of 100 animals which produce organic dairy products, including a good deal of organic milk (or koumiss) that he sells in the summer. He feeds his livestock in countryside and brings his organic dairy products to Uvurhangai province to sell. He wants to expand his dairy business by buying a cow. He explains why with these words: "Our children will soon start college. I have to save enough money for their tuition." Gundtsamba is good-natured man and is requesting a loan for 1,300,000 MNT to pay for the cow.

loans.use: to expand an organic dairy products business by buying a cow.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old young man, married, and a father to two sons and one daughter.  He is a worker and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's needs or to help him finish building his house.  Mohammad is requesting a 2,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing the necessary construction supplies such as cement and sand. This will speed the process of completing the house and enable Mohammad to offer his family more suitable home conditions.

Mohammad is photographed next to his house.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en: For the last 10 years, Sherali has earned a living by working on a collective farm where he grows cucumbers, onions and wheat on 1.50 hectares of land. He sells his produce in a local market. He lives with his wife and four children, and his wife stays at home to raise their children in a good way. Sherali is applying for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers to use on his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 36, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Paul, her business partner, and is a mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorna operates a printing business. She mainly offers signboards, sticker boards, tarpaulins, and other printed materials used in business establishments, schools, and the like. They buy their materials and supplies for printing and manufacture different printed materials that their customers require. Her regular customers are business owners, students, and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP10,000. She will be using the loan to buy supplies and raw materials needed for her business. She expects a boost in her revenue as she expands her business.  

Lorna hopes to grow her business and dreams she will be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and other raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeanette Madina

texts.en: Madine is 33 years old and has earned a living for the last seven years by selling different kinds of products such as stoves, jerry cans, hoes and many other items. He is requesting a loan to buy more stoves and hoes to sell to his customers. He will use the profits he earns from this loan to renovate the house he lives in.

loans.use: to buy stoves and hoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is 33 years old, married and works in a school while her husband works as a farmer. They do not earn enough money to cover their needs, including medical expenses for Alia, who is suffering from a disease. She is requesting a loan from FATEN to pay for her medical expenses so she can recover her health and live in normal conditions with her husband.

loans.use: to cover the cost of urgent medical expenses.

loans.name: Nores Nore

texts.es:
Nores tiene 47 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 7 hijos a los cuales ella ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo solo ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono cuando todavía eran muy pequeños  pero ha sabido salir adelante gracias a su optimismo y lucha. Su humilde vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, , ciudad caracteriza da por su clima muy cálido así como también se desarrolla la agricultura en especial los cultivos de tuna, frejol, maíz, ente otros, también encontramos a la Líneas de Nazca, las cuales son jeroglifos ubicados en un extenso campo de tierra árida las cuales servían como especie de calendario para la antigua cultura Nazca. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión en especial sus novelas, ya que la distrae de las preocupaciones del día a día. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero él hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con  mucho esfuerzo Nores trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, frutas y abarrotes  en el mercado de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece buenos productos a precios cómodos.

Nores está muy agradecida y feliz con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como cebolla, papa, limones al por mayor, cerveza, agua mineral entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener mejores productos y mayor variedad, con lo cual podrá mejorar su ingresos y seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande y seguir apoyando a sus hijos a salir adelante”.
texts.en:
Nores, 47, is a hard-working woman.  She is the mother of 7 children who she has had to work hard to support because their father abandoned the family when the children were still very young.  She has carried on, though, despite the hardships.  She lives in a modest house in the city of Nazca.  Nazca is known for its mild climate and for the famous Nazca Lines, huge hieroglyphs carved into the hard earth by the ancient Nazca culture and believed to be a sort of calendar.  Farms in the area produce beans, maize, etc.  Nores likes to watch television when she can spare the time for it.  She especially likes telenovelas because they are a happy distraction from her everyday worries.  She would have liked to have gone to college, but her parents couldn't afford it and she was only able to finish a few years of high school.

Nores operates a business selling fruits, vegetables and groceries at a local market.  She works 10 hours a day and sees up to 20 customers.  She says that she is happy with the business and that it is successful because she provides a good service and good products at a reasonable price.

Nores is grateful to Kiva lenders because your loans have allowed her to stock the merchandise--onions, potatoes, lemons, beer, mineral water, etc.--she needs to stay in business.  Thanks to your loans, she has been able to buy better products and a wider range of merchandise and, in turn, increase her income.  She tells us that her greatest wish is "To have a larger store and go on helping her children get ahead".

loans.use: to stock her fruit and vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es: Ana recurre por tercera vez a un credikiva para seguir comprando ropa para damas y caballeros, calzado, sábanas y cubrelechos, que está segura venderá rápidamente dentro de sus clientes puesto que le han hecho pedidos con anterioridad.  Con sus créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar sus ventas y a su vez obtener mayores utilidades, siente que le ha ido muy bien al trabajar con dinero prestado a bajas tasas y cuotas mensuales que puede cancelar cómodamente.  Su mensaje para los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy agradecida con las personas que me han ayudado para seguir adelante con mi negocio y espero que lo sigan haciendo con todos los pequeños empresarios”.
texts.en:
Ana turns to a Kiva loan for the third time in order to buy clothing for women and men, shoes, sheets, and bedspreads.  She is sure that they will sell rapidly to her customers because they have previously made orders.

With her previous loans she managed to increase her sales and get greater profits.  She feels that working with the loan with its low interest rates and monthly payments has gone very well for her, and she is comfortably able to repay the loan.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following, “I am grateful to the people who have helped me get ahead in my business.  I hope they continue helping all of the small business people.”

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and linens.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: La socia Rene dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Urubamba y Calca. La socia Rene solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es incrementar producción. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. En esta oportunidad la socia Rene requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas.
texts.en: Our member, Rene, makes her living farming and raising animals for sale.  She says that her favorite time of the year is the harvest because that's when her hard work finally pays off.  She has operated the business for several years and tells us that her biggest challenge is transporting her crop for storage in the cities of Urubamba and Calca.  Rene is applying for a loan that she will use to carry out one of her plans for increasing production.  She is committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time and knows that she has to be a dependable partner to be considered for future loans.  She will use the funds from this loan to buy seeds and organic manure for her farming business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Wellars

texts.en:
Wellars is 53 years old, married, and has six children. His wife works as a business woman. 

Wellars is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy salt, cooking oil, rice, and sugar to sell in a shop he has been running for six years. He will use the profits from the business to reinvest in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase salt, cooking oil, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is 30 years old. He sells clothes and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more shirts and trousers for gents. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells different items in a store. She has spent seven years in that business. With the loan, she wants to add maize flour, cassava flour, and rice for sale. With the profits from the business, she plans to buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, cassava flour and rice for her store

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is from the village Napareuli in East Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: husband Ivane and their 25-year-old son. She requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Ivane works as a night watchman on a village farm. Her son is a worker in the village. Natela is a housewife. Their total average monthly income is 250 Laris. According to Credo estimations, Natela and her family belong to the subsistence poor category. 

Natela requested an agricultural loan from Credo to start up a small-scale agricultural business. Her loan request was approved because of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to loans, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Natela will cultivate the family-owned 0.3 hectares of land and sow maize. In particular, with the loaned amount she will rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase maize for sowing. She will work hard on the plot during summer period to get a good harvest in early fall. Natela will sell harvested maize on the local open market. As a result of the Kiva loan, the family will get additional income and will use if for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase maize

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. Donde un grupo de vecinos formaron el Banco Comunal  “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.
