En esta zona los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo. Luz Mery tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde cosecha y siembre dependiendo a la época diferentes productos como por ejemplo lechuga, asnapa, ruda, perejil, maíz, papa y otras cosas más. Ella en el interior de su casa tiene una granja donde se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran vegetales y hortalizas. El crédito que ha solicitado Luz Mery será destinado para comprar más semillas. Luz Mery es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
In the city of Calca, in Cusco department, there is a place known as Arin community. It is known for its beautiful landscape, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.  This is location of a group of neighbors form the Virgen Concebida de Arin communal bank.

The inhabitants of this area devote themselves to agriculture, livestock, and tourism.  Luz Mery has various plots of land where, depending on the different seasons, she plants and harvests different products like lettuce,  asnapa (an herb), rue, parsley, corn, potatoes, and other items. She also has an area at her home where she raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. Her parents taught her the farming trade when she was a young girl, and now she has her own land that she works with her life partner, where they plant vegetables with great care.

The loan Luz Mery has requested will be used to buy more seeds. Luz Mery is a hard-working woman who has always known how to get ahead in life and obtain what she wants.

loans.use: to buy more seeds.

loans.name: Maqsood's Group

texts.en:
Maqsood is a 60-year-old widow. She has had some difficult periods in her life, particularly after the sudden death of her husband. She operates a boutique business from her home and sells different qualities of clothes to her clients.

Maqsood has given birth to two sons. Both of them are more than 30 years old and unmarried. The elder one is a truck driver, while her younger son drives an autorickshaw.

Maqsood has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan investment she will buy clothes for her boutique. She has been operating her business for the past many years and is confident that the loan will be a productive one for her. She also wants to see her elder son marry and she is hopeful that she will be able to save some profits for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy clothes for boutique business

loans.name: Norov

texts.en: Norov is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornigovi province, Mongolia. His children go to secondary schools. His wife is a shop assistant. Norov is van driver and works for a local service provider. He also runs a taxi service with his own car. He operates his taxi business every weekend and when he is on vacation. He started his taxi business in 2009. His monthly income is around 250,000 MNT; he makes 15,000-20,000 MNT a day. Due to the unpaved roads in the countryside of Mongolia, his car has been broken and needs to be repaired. He is a good-natured and hardworking man. He said, "It's been terrible since my car broke down because I'm the main provider for my family. My elder daughter will soon go to college, and she needs my support more than ever." The total amount he is requesting is 1,400,000 MNT. He will spend 250,000 MNT to purchase four tires. He will use the rest of the loan amount of purchase a weather cloth cover and felt roof for his ger, which will protect his family from cold and rain.

loans.use: To purchase four tires for his car, and a weather cloth cover and felt roof for his ger

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en más mercadería variada, comprándose blusas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, ropa para niños, en diferentes estilos, esta decisión del nuevo préstamo la tomó debido a que su nivel de inventario ha disminuido y considera que es una desventaja para mantenerse en el comercio.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue favorable ya que le aumentó la capacidad al negocio, manteniendo una gran variedad de productos en prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
Oscar is requesting a new loan so that he can invest in more merchandise of various types. He will buy blouses, skirts, dresses, undergarments, and children's clothing in different styles. His decision to take a new loan was driven by the fact that his inventory has diminished, so he is at a disadvantage when it comes to maintaining his business.

The effect of his previous loan was favorable since he was able to increase his business capacity and maintain a wide variety of clothes for women and men.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, undergarments, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Luz Mila

texts.es:
Luz Mila abrió un pequeño negocio de venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria y con este pequeño negocio que ha colocado Luz Mila trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia mediante los ingresos de sus ventas diarias. 

En esta oportunidad Luz Mila con el prestamo va comprar insumos como por ejemplo Carne y papas y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementa sus ingresos. Luz Mila es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Luz Mila operates her own small business where she travels around selling anticuchos (traditional Peruvian skewered, grilled meats). She works very hard to provide for her family with her daily earnings from sales.

With the support from this loan, Luz Mila plans to purchase input items such as meat and potatoes for making her food items. She hopes that this will allow her to satisfy customer demand and gradually increase her profits. Luz Mila is known by her neighbors as a happy woman who is always willing to help others, and as a responsible mother who always works hard to provide for her family and get ahead in life through effort and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase input items, such as meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old single young man. He works in a local university cafeteria and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his needs. Hasan will get married soon, so he is preparing his house to get ready for this occasion.

Hasan is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of painting the house and preparing the bathrooms by installing sinks and bathtubs. This will improve the house's condition and enable Hasan to prepare his house well before getting married to live with his wife in suitable home conditions. 

Hasan is photographed in his house.

loans.use: to paint the house and prepare the bathrooms

loans.name: Wazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Wazeeran is a very active lady with two sons and two daughters, all of whom who are enrolled in local school and getting their education. Wazeeran operates a livestock business from her home. She gets up early in the morning and milks her buffaloes and sells the milk to clients in her community.

Wazeeran's husband operates a grocery business in the community market that sells salt, sugar, and other grocery items at very reasonable rates. Wazeeran has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan funds he will buy flour, sugar, and salt in bulk quantity, which will allow him fill his client's orders on time and increase his income. Wazeeran's husband has been operating his business for the past many years, and Wazeeran is confident about his business success.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is married with three sons, all of whom are getting their education at a nearby school. Saima stays at home and manages the household. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.  

Saima's husband operates a garment shop where he sells clothing, such as t-shirts, pants, and shorts, to his customers. The variety of products and reasonable prices encourage customers to come to his shop. He has been in this business for many years. 

Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy garments in larger quantities and of far better quality. Saima is hopeful that the loan will improve her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy garments for sale.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is from the Napareuli village in East Georgia. She is 25 years old and lives with her uncle. Inga’s uncle is an agricultural worker in the village, and Inga is unemployed. The total average monthly income of the family is 150 GEL. According to Credo estimations, Inga and her uncle belong to the "vulnerable poor" category. Inga has requested loans from local financial institutions for an agricultural business start-up several times, but her loan requests were rejected because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Inga requested an agricultural loan from Credo to start a small-scale agricultural business. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages providing start-up and re-start credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income levels. 

With the loan credit, Inga will cultivate her family's 0.4 hectare property. In particular, she will rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase maize for sowing. Inga will work hard on the plot during the summer to get a good harvest in early fall, and she will sell the harvested maize at the local open market. As a result of the Kiva loan, Inga will earn additional income and will use it to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase maize.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a mother of seven from southern Israel. She left school after the tenth grade, but she has found a niche where she is succeeding, selling jewelry in her area. She sells by individual orders and has slowly built a steady stream of customers.

Miram needs this loan to purchase silver settings and additional stock. She wants to expand her business and reach more customers.

loans.use: to purchase silver settings and jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es: Con su anterior crédito, Liliana invirtió principalmente en la compra de verduras e insumos utilizados para la elaboración de los fritos y desayunos con pescado que vende a diario, con esto ha visto que sus ventas se han incrementado y su estructura ha mejorado, tal y como deseaba que ocurriera con la inversión realizada.  Con su nueva financiación pretende comprar cajas de verduras, tubérculos y hortalizas como papa, pepino, remolacha, zanahoria, tomate, etc. ya que así es más económico y le brinda una mayor rentabilidad, sus clientes cada vez le solicitan nuevos productos a los que quiere responder.  Su mensaje para los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias, ustedes son una entidad muy seria y su apoyo ha sido de gran ayuda”
texts.en: Liliana invested her previous loan in buying vegetables and other supplies that she uses in preparing the fried food and fish breakfasts that she sells every day.  As a result, her sales increased and her structure improved as she hoped would happen as a result of the investment.  She plans to use her new loan to buy boxes of greens and root vegetables such as potatoes, cucumbers, beets, carrots, tomatoes, etc. because it works out cheaper to buy them this way and makes her more profits.  Her customers are always requesting new dishes and she would like to be able to respond to this demand.  Her message to Kiva is: "Thank you.  You are a very reputable business and your support has been very helpful".

loans.use: to buy boxes of greens and root vegetables

loans.name: Paul Bienvenu

texts.fr: Paul Bienvenu est âgé de 43 ans et est marié à un certain Noussirath. Paul Bienvenu a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge et dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Paul Bienvenu vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour y arriver, Paul Bienvenu exerce comme métier, le rebobinage. De façon secondaire, Paul Bienvenu vend des pompes à eau et des générateurs dans sa région. Paul Bienvenu s'approvisionne au Nigeria. Il y a environs dix huit ans que Paul Bienvenu exerce cette activité. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Paul Bienvenu sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Paul Bienvenu avait obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Paul Bienvenu is 43 years old and married to Nossirath.  He stopped his education at the secondary school (high school) level.  He and his wife have four children who are all attending school and in their care.  Three of them are their own children.  Paul Bienvenu lives together with his wife and children.  The couple both work to cover their household needs.  Paul Bienvenu works as an electric motor repairer.  As a secondary activity, he also sells water pumps and generators in his region.  He has been in this business for around 18 years and stocks up in Nigeria.  With a view to building up his business and being better able to meet his customer demand, Paul Bienvenu is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  He has already received two previous loans which he repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy water pumps and generators

loans.name: Melia

texts.es:
Melia tiene 43 años, está separada de su pareja, es madre de dos hijos: Isbet de 5 y Yordy de 2 años. Los tres viven en la casa que el padre de sus hijos construyó antes de separarse.

Ella logró culminar sus estudios de docencia, ahora es profesora en una escuela estatal, donde enseña a leer y escribir a niños menores. Su trabajo es muy bueno y sacrificado, por ello la nombraron supervisora del programa de alfabetización del estado.
Pero la actividad que le enseñaron desde niña fue la agricultura, y ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la siembra de café, plátano y yuca. Los que comercializa en la cooperativa de su comunidad, como también en diversos mercados de su ciudad. La venta del plátano la realiza cada 20 días, con esas ganancias solventa sus necesidades más urgentes. Melia se siente contenta con su actividad agrícola, aunque la docencia la ejerce con verdadera vocación. 

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y agradece a su banco comunal “Progreso del palomar”, por darle la oportunidad de salir adelante con su negocio. Se siente a gusto de tener socios muy responsables.
Melia destinará los 1500 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono para fertilizar su cafetal y para pagar a los operarios quienes la apoyarán en esta labor.
texts.en:
Melia is 43 years old and separated from her partner. She is the mother of two children: Isbet (age 5) and Yordy (age 2). The three of them live in a house that the father of her children built before they separated.

Melia just finished her studies to become a teacher and now works at a state school where she teaches young children how to read and write. Her work is very noble and requires sacrifice. For this reason, she was chosen to become the supervisor over a state literacy program. However, Melia learned how to farm when she was a young girl and has been growing coffee, bananas, and cassava for more than 20 years. Her products are sold at the cooperative in her community, but also at various markets throughout the city. The bananas are sold every 20 days, which generates income to provide for the most urgent needs. Melia is pleased with her farming activities, although teaching is her true profession.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is grateful that her Communal Bank "Progreso del Palomar" has given her the opportunity to move forward with her business. She gets along well with the other members, who are very responsible. Melia will use this loan of 1,500 PEN to buy sacks of compost to fertilize her coffee crop and to pay the workers who help with the labor.

loans.use: to buy compost and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Her husband Basel appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured next to their house.

Nadia is a 36-year-old woman, and she and her husband have three sons and three daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver, and his salary is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Nadia wants to make some necessary repairs to her house so she can provide suitable conditions for her family. She is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of making some necessary repairs, such as painting and installing new windows. This will create better living conditions for Nadia and her family.

loans.use: to repair her house and improve its condition.

loans.name: Naema

texts.en:
Naema is 57 years old, married, and three children.  For the past four years, she has been selling groceries, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Naema is requesting a loan for $1,000 from FATEN, which will help her cover the costs of purchasing a variety of  groceries that her customers often request, such as milk, rice, sugar, flour, and canned food. These goods will allow Naema to meet the needs of her customers and to compete with other grocery stores.  The increase in sales will improve the family's income.

Naema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her elder son appears in her Kiva profile photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité El Progreso se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San Pedro, el grupo lleva por nombre el progreso, ya que es en busca de eso que se han unidos estas mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras. Ellas están en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya, y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y ayudarse.
Gloria es una mujer muy emprendedora, que siempre se esfuerza por poder ayudar a su familia. Ella por medio de su trabajo y su arduo esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y día a día mejorar su estilo de vida, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo y marca, gracias a lo cual tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'El Progreso' committee is made up of a number of neighbors from the city of San Pedro.  The group is called 'El Progreso' (progress) because it is in seeking progress that these hard-working and entrepreneurial women joined together.  They are currently in their first loan cycle within Fundación Paraguaya's Entrepreneurial Women's Program and they are learning to work together and help each other.

Gloria is a very entrepreneurial woman who always works hard so that she can help her family.  Through her efforts and hard work, she has been able to make progress and continually improve her lifestyle.  She tells us that her business is selling all different types and brands of cosmetics.  This work gives her the money she needs to help her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy all types of cosmetics so that she can stock up and thereby be able to continue offering her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 62 años, está casada con Segundino, de 70 años. Tienen 11 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos: Esther de 20 y Álvaro de 18 años. La casa donde viven es propia, y es el fruto del trabajo de ambos (Felicita y Segundino). Se ubica en la localidad de Sanchirio.

Hace 40 años que se dedica, con ahínco, a las labores agrícolas junto a su esposo. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivo, donde cuida de sus plantaciones de maíz, plátano y café. Estos productos son los que más satisfacciones le generan, aunque también siembra yucas y paltas. Ella se siente emocionada cada vez que llega la época de cosecha de café, ya que lo considera como todo un acontecimiento, pues contrata personal, prepara alimentos para muchas personas y los atiende mientras trabajan en sus tierras. Además, cuenta con animales de granja como gallinas y cerdos, los que vende después de engordarlos. Según afirma, le gusta estar en el campo, por ello está planeando, para más adelante, aumentar su producción, ampliando sus terrenos.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se siente agradecida por todos estos años en que esta microfinanciera ha confiado en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso del palomar”, donde todos sus socios son responsables y empeñosos.
Felicitas invertirá este dinero en la compra de nuevas plantitas de café para llenar los espacios vacíos de su terreno.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 62 years old and married to Segundino, age 70. They have 11 children, but only two live with them: Esther (age 20) and Álvaro (age 18). The home they live in is their own and was a result of their hard work. They reside in the town of Sanchirio.

For the past 40 years, Felicitas has been farming with great dedication alongside her husband. Every morning, she heads out to her farmland where she looks after her corn, banana, and coffee crops. These crops are the most satisfying to grow, but she also plants cassava and avocados. She gets very excited whenever it is time to harvest the coffee and treats it as if it were a special event. Felicitas will hire workers and prepare food for them while they work in the fields. In addition, she has animal pens where she raises chickens and pigs that are eventually sold once they have been fattened. According to her, she enjoys working in the fields. Later on, she plans to increase her production and acquire more land.

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is grateful to everyone who has helped to provide her with microloans over the years so that she could continue her work. Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank "Progreso del Palomar", where all of the members are responsible and industrious. She will invest the money in new coffee seedlings to fill the empty spaces of land.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is from Imertubani, South Georgia. She is 32 years old and lives with her family: her husband, Gocha; her mother-in-law; and two sons, nine and six years old, who go to school. Maka has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trade business start-up several times, but her loan requests were rejected because of her family’s low income and the higher risks associated with start-up businesses.

Maka and Gocha have 2 hectares of land where they grow potatoes, which they sell to local wholesalers. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 GEL. According to Credo estimations Maka and her family belong to the "subsistence poor" category. 

Maka requested an agricultural loan from Credo to start a small-scale agricultural business. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages providing start-up and re-start credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income levels.

With the loan credit, Maka will purchase a mini-bus. She and Gocha will use it to transport fruits and vegetables for sale. They will purchase produce from local farmers at wholesale prices and sell it from the mini-bus in nearby towns. The family will earn additional income and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for a produce sales start-up.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 58-year-old Bedouin woman from Negev. Due to family and cultural reasons, she never had the opportunity to study, but for years she has managed a stall near the market where she sells clothing and simple shoes. Aisha wants to diversify and begin selling jewelry so that she can expand her customer base.

Aisha needed this loan to purchase clothing and prepare for the upcoming seasons, both summer and the start of school in the fall.

Aisha wants to see her business activity continue, since it brings important income to her and her family. She dreams of one day making the pilgrimage to Mecca.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in his taxi.

Montaha is a 28-year-old married woman with two sons. Her husband is a taxi driver. This is a profitable project, but it is the only source of income for the family and the business needs more support to be able to cover the family's needs.

Montaha wants to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of repairing the taxi. These include changing the wheels, installing new mirrors and lights, and painting. This will improve the taxi's condition and enable Montaha's husband to work extra hours and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud, photographed next to his taxi, is a 43-year-old married man with five sons between two and ten years old.

For the past seven years, Mahmoud has owned and operated a taxi service, and he has a good reputation among customers. The project is a profitable one, but he needs more support to cover the costs of operation.

Mahmoud is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of painting the taxi and making some necessary repairs. This will increase the taxi's efficiency and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to paint and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ganado para el destazo, en esta oportunidad comprará dos vaquillas, para poder comercializar su carne, ella manifiesta que debido a la necesidad económica se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para seguir creciendo en el negocio.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le sirvió para seguir generando ingresos y poder sostener a su familia, de lo mismo el aumento en sus ventas le permite tener una condición estable de la cual logró cancelar las cuotas del préstamo y también ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lorena is requesting a new loan so that she can continue investing in buying cattle to slaughter.  On this occasion, she will buy two heifers so that she can sell their meat.  She tells us that, owing to her financial need, she decided to request a new loan so that she can continue growing her business.

Lorena's previous loan had a positive effect.  She was able to continue making income and was able to support her family.  Her sales increased and she was able to enjoy some stability.  She was able to make her loan repayments on time and also help her children.

loans.use: to buy two heifers
